title: Man City player ratings vs Brentford as Joao Cancelo and Ilkay Gundogan poor
description: Manchester City were beaten in injury-time by Brentford on a frustrating afternoon when too many players underperformed.
text: Ederson Made some good saves early on with City under pressure and was called into action on several occasions in the second half. Big late save to deny Toney. 7 John Stones Didn't make much use of the possession he had and was troubled defensively, by Henry down Brentford's left and from long balls. 5 Manuel Akanji Outjumped by Ben Mee in the lead-up to Brentford's goal and given a tough time by the excellent Ivan Toney. 5  READ MORE: City vs Brentford as it happened  Aymeric Laporte Wasn't great for Toney's goal, but played better after having his head strapped and made one brilliant clearance in the second half when a goal looked certain. 7 Joao Cancelo Lacked his usual playmaking quality from left back. Link with Foden wasn't as natural as it's been with others. Booked for diving late on. 5 Rodri Told off by Guardiola for one backwards pass than put Akanji under pressure and was never at his best. 6 Ilkay Gundogan Couple of loose passes and heavy touches in the first half set the tone for City's struggles. Had to do better with a second-half chance and then let Toney in front of him for the dramatic late winner. 4 Kevin De Bruyne Had his fair share of injury disappointment during tournament football so hard to blame him for being cautious, but bar one spell in the first half he was fairly quiet. 6 Bernardo Silva Bright down the left and almost won a penalty with one fine flick past Henry. Nimble footwork kept Brentford on their toes. 7 Phil Foden Started like he was lacking rhythm, which was understandable after his recent lack of action, but took his goal quite brilliantly. 7 Erling Haaland Have to wonder how fit he was. Did his best to reach a couple of crosses that were just too heavy and did set Gundogan up for a golden chance, but didn't carry his usual threat. 6  Substitutes  Julian Alvarez Had one chance on the breakaway but delayed a decision too long and then passed the ball behind Haaland. 5   READ NEXT:

title: Mo'Nique sues Netflix for racial discrimination
description: No description
text: Student gunman pulls semi-pistol out of his backpack and empties magazine on five classmates in California high school quad, killing one, before shooting himself in the head on his 16th birthday   Marine, 30, kills both of his parents as they sleep and two family dogs before walking into a police station in a blood-stained shirt and confessing to the murders  A second U.S. embassy staffer overheard Trump's call to EU ambassador Gordon Sondland demanding an update on 'investigations' day after notorious Ukraine phone call  Top border official admits the Trump administration has built ZERO new sections of border wall one year before the election as he defends his 'acting' title  Students and teachers at California high school recall moment gunman, 16, opened fire at 7.45am in quad, killing teenage girl, 16, and wounding another four    Nancy Pelosi accuses Trump of BRIBERY for holding back Ukraine's military aid in dramatic escalation of Democrats' impeachment attack - and calls public testimony 'devastating'   'I have never seen a direct link': Ukraine's foreign minister says Donald Trump's EU ambassador never spelled out a connection between military aid and a Biden probe   'Saving democracy one gulp at a time': George XXXX-2's giant water bottle during his testimony at impeachment inquiry becomes a viral sensation with dozens of memes poking fun at the 'well hydrated' witness  'This is a Hail Mary from two stadiums over!' Former Massachusetts governor Deval Patrick enters packed Democratic 2020 race admitting he is the ultimate long shot  'It was like a homeless shelter!' Inside a nine-day Juul research study where participant claims men and women slept in same room and puffed on leaking nicotine pods that 'taste like poison' in filthy enclosure  Cops detain EIGHT people after American teacher, 63, is tortured, murdered and left hogtied on her bed three days after moving into new apartment in Dominican Republic  The comedian filed a lawsuit in Los Angeles Superior Court on Thursday alleging that she was unfairly treated because of her race.   She claims that Netflix offered her just $500,000 in a 'talent fee' for a one-off, hour-long stand-up special in November 2017.   Monique is suing Netflix claiming she was discriminated against as a black woman.  Netflix paid Amy Schumer $13mllion for her one-hour stand-up special (seen right) but Mo'Nique was only offered $500,000 for hers  Amy Schumer, however, was initially offered $11million for a similarly formatted show and ended up getting $13million after negotiations.   She also cited the cases of male comedians including Ricky Gervais, Chris Rock and Dave Chapelle, all of whom were paid considerably more than her and Schumer.   Mo'Nique never ended up making her show with the streaming service.   The lawsuit is not the first time she has accused of it discrimination, but it does take her allegations to court.   She is seeking unspecified damages.   'Despite Mo’Nique’s extensive résumé and documented history of comedic success, when Netflix presented her with an offer of employment for an exclusive stand-up comedy special, Netflix made a lowball offer that was only a fraction of what Netflix paid other (non-Black female) comedians,' one of her attorneys said in the filing.   'When the talent was not a Black woman, Netflix offered to pay, and did pay, astronomically more than it pays to Black women like it offered to Mo'Nique,' they continued.   Mo'Nique took to Instagram to confirm the lawsuit on Thursday.   'I can confirm that today I filed a pay discrimination lawsuit against Netflix. I had a choice to make: I could accept what I felt was pay discrimination or I could stand up for those who came before me and those who will come after me.  'I chose to stand up. I don't have any further comment at this time, but I appreciate all of your support and love,' she said.   In her lawsuit, her attorneys also alleged that the company has a severe lack of diversity at its core.  It also claimed that the company 'turned a blind eye' to racism, including on the set of House of Cards where, the suit claims, Kevin Spacey used the 'N' word.   He said, according to the lawsuit, that he no longer wanted African American people 'on my set'.   Spacey did not immediately respond to DailyMail.com's inquiries on Thursday afternoon.   He is not being sued.    It also alleges that a director of communications also used the N word during a meeting with 60 people in it.    Netflix did not immediately respond to DailyMail.com's inquiries, nor did Schumer.    Both Ricky Gervais and Dave Chapelle were paid considerably more for their deals. Gervais got a reported $40million for two shows, whereas Chapelle was given $60million   Wynonna Judd's daughter Grace, 23, is released from prison six years early after she was sentenced for violating probation in 2017   Outrage as Survivor contestant who said a castmate 'inappropriately touched' her is voted OFF show and he gets to STAY on island   'Harry has got to sort himself out': Queen's former spokesman Dickie Arbiter says prince must heal rift with brother William with Meghan's help   'My bump was taken away so swiftly': Hilaria Baldwin mourns the loss of the pregnant belly title: Kaizer Chiefs’ Arthur Zwane shares big statement on the Nedbank Cup
description: Kaizer Chiefs’ Arthur Zwane tells it like it is, doesn’t he? This time the assistant coach has made a big statement about the Nedbank Cup.
text: Can local football return already!? Kaizer Chiefs’ Arthur Zwane has said Amakhosi want to win the Nedbank Cup before the 32-club tournament has begun.    ALSO READ: Nathi Mthethwa says PSL is not ready to reopen stadiums to fans    KAIZER CHIEFS ARTHUR ZWANE: AMAKHOSI WANT THE NEDBANK CUP    The former winger who was affectionately known as “10 111” – spoke on the Nedbank Cup after the Premier Soccer League confirmed the last 32 draw last week.    As The South African reported last week, Kaizer Chiefs were matched up against TS Galaxy, and Zwane is expecting ultimate glory.    “We are a team that needs to grind results,” said Zwane as quoted by IOL.    Nearly every coach in local and world football always say it’s about one game at a time in tournaments – but not Kaizer Chiefs’ Arthur Zwane.    “We were hoping and wishing that we will go as far as we want to in the (Nedbank) cup and be in the final and then bring it home. And why not win it – that is our aim.    “We’ll take one game at a time,” Kaizer Chiefs’ Arthur Zwane concluded.    LISTED: STUART BAXTER’S MOST USED PLAYERS SINCE JULY    Sections of Kaizer Chiefs fans wanted Stuart Baxter sacked after only one victory in his first eight games. But things change very fast in football, thanks to the Englishman’s five wins in the past seven games. Isn’t that good?    As often is the case for any struggling coach, poor results encourage fans to question your team selection decisions. Baxter was hammered for omitting the club’s beloved youngsters such as Nkosingiphile Ngcobo, Happy Mashiane, as well as Bafana Bafana’s hugely popular defender Njabulo Ngcobo and of course the club’s living legend Itumeleng Khune.    A storm of criticism befell Baxter but he firmly stuck to his guns.    In Baxter’s 16 games so far, 12 players featured in 10 games or more. Read the full story here.    ALSO READ: Kaizer Chiefs latest – Arthur Zwane reveals a rather ‘UNREALISTIC’ target

title: لواء طيار متقاعد يكشف سبب استمرار معركة المنصورة لـ 53 دقيقة.. فيديو
description: No description
text: قال اللواء طيار متقاعد سمير عزيز، إن معركة المنصورة كانت مدتها 53 دقيقة؛ لأن قوات العدو جاءت علينا على موجات، الأولى كانت طائرات فانتوم، ومعها قنابل.وأضاف سمير عزيز، خلال حواره في برنامج "صاحبة السعادة" المذاع على قناة "دى ام سى"، أن طائرات العدو كان عددها 120، وكانوا يقومون بالهجوم على دفعات، ولكن لو قاموا بالهجوم مرة واحدة؛ كانت المعركة استغرقت من 5 إلى 7 دقائق.وأوضح سمير عزيز، أن العدو كان يريد تدمير الدلتا بأكملها، خصوصا المنصورة، لأنه كان يوجد بها لواء جوي كامل.وأكد أن هناك وقتا في المنصورة لم تكن فيه طائرة واحدة على الأرض؛ وذلك لأن هناك سربين يتقاتلان مع العدو في الهواء، وظل اللواء لمدة ربع ساعة لم يكن به ولا طائرة على الأرض.وأشار إلى أن المهندسين كانوا يقومون بتجهيز أسلحة الطائرة بمجرد نزولها في وقت لا يتعدى 6 دقائق.

title: Jim Gianopulos Confirmed to Run Paramount Following Viacom, CBS Merger
description: Jim Gianopulos will continue to oversee film operations following Viacom’s merger with CBS, the companies confirmed on Monday. The move was expected and comes as the media marriage is being wrapped up. Gianopulos’ title will be chairman and CEO of Paramount Pictures. His mandate will continue to be calling the shots at Paramount Animation, Paramount […]
text: Jim Gianopulos  will continue to oversee film operations following Viacom’s merger with CBS, the companies confirmed on Monday. The move was expected and comes as the media marriage is being wrapped up.  Gianopulos’ title will be chairman and CEO of  Paramount  Pictures. His mandate will continue to be calling the shots at  Paramount  Animation, Paramount Features, Paramount Players and Paramount TV. He joined the company in 2017 after decades at 20th Century Fox, where he climbed the ranks to eventually become its studio chief. Gianopulos is known for having strong relationships with the creative community and a deep understanding of the international marketplace.  In Paramount, he inherited a studio in disarray. His predecessor, Brad Grey, had overseen a series of financial failures and the company was faulted for having few major franchises in its arsenal. Gianopulos’ tenure has been mixed. The studio had a hit last summer with the Elton John biopic “Rocketman” and its “Mission: Impossible” series continues to be a reliable profit-generator, but recent films such as “Terminator: Dark Fate” and “Gemini Man” have been box office losers. However, Gianopulos was handpicked by Shari Redstone, who will become chairman of the combined company, and has her support as he tries to reinvigorate the studio.  The combined company will be known as ViacomCBS. Over the weekend, the company’s announced a series of leadership appointments. CBS chief creative officer David Nevins added oversight of Viacom-owned BET Networks, while MTV/VH1 chief Chris McCarthy took over Comedy Central, Paramount Network and other channels. As part of that shakeup, Comedy Central chief XXXX-2 Alterman and Viacom media networks COO Sarah Levy exited the company.  In addition, head of Nickelodeon Brian Robbins is becoming president, kids and family entertainment at ViacomCBS. The Viacom-CBS union is expected to close as soon as early December. The new entity will be led by current Viacom chief Bob Bakish.  Costume designer Sandy Powell has over 50 credits to her name and has won three Academy Awards. She has worked with Todd Haynes, Jean-Marc Vallée, Rob Marshall, Stephen Frears and Martin Scorsese. “The Irishman” marks her seventh time collaborating with Scorsese, but this was an epic. The film spans five decades from the 1950s to [...]  Jim Gianopulos will continue to oversee film operations following Viacom’s merger with CBS, the companies confirmed on Monday. The move was expected and comes as the media marriage is being wrapped up. Gianopulos’ title will be chairman and CEO of Paramount Pictures. His mandate will continue to be calling the shots at Paramount Animation, Paramount [...]  Netflix continues to push into local content, producing its first Dutch film, war drama “The Battle of the Scheldt,” in partnership with local broadcasters and other backers. Alain de Levita is producing the Dutch-Belgian picture through his Levitate Film banner. It will be in movie theaters in the Netherlands in November 2020, and on Netflix [...]  Roland Emmerich’s big-budget World War II film “Midway” was no match for local drama “Better Days” at China’s box office, bringing in $3 million less than the top-earning Chinese title, which is already in its third weekend in theaters. One of the more expensive independent films ever made on a budget of $98 million, the [...]  Kristin Scott Thomas will be honored at this year’s British Independent Film Awards with the Richard Harris Award for her contribution to British film. Thomas will join a celebrated list of former honorees including Judi Dench in 2018, and Daniel Day-Lewis, Emma Thompson and Chiwetel Ejiiofor in years past. Thomas’ film work includes “Four Weddings [...]  We’ve all seen couples like Gota and Chika Yanagida — some of us may even be in one. In writer-director Shin Adachi’s “A Beloved Wife,” the Yanagidas bicker constantly, turning their near-constant state of marital conflict into a kind of public performance, sucking friends and strangers alike into the typhoon of their discomfort. Are they [...]  The Mediterranean island nation of Malta has long been attracting international film and TV productions mainly for tales with either a strong marine or biblical element, and often for limited portions of the overall shoot. Now Malta is trying to make a quantum leap to lure a wider scope of productions for longer stays. And [...]

title: First potential opening date set for Silver Line into Loudoun
description: The Silver Line to Dulles International Airport and Loudoun County, Virginia, will open on or about July 16, 2020, at least if everything goes according to plan from here on out, the Metropolitan Washington Airports Authority said. --
text: The Silver Line to Dulles International Airport and Loudoun County, Virginia, will open on or about July 16, 2020, at least if everything goes according to plan.  A view of test trains rolling into Loudoun Gateway on the Silver Line. (Courtesy Dulles Corridor Metrorail Project)  The Silver Line to Dulles International Airport and Loudoun County, Virginia, will open on or about July 16, 2020, at least if everything goes according to plan from here on out, the Metropolitan Washington Airports Authority said.  For the first time, the authority has set an official internal projected opening date for rail service on the six-station second phase of the Silver Line from Wiehle-Reston East to Loudoun Gateway and Ashburn.  “The current date to open the system to the public is July 16, 2020. That is our goal at this point, and we’re working very hard to meet it,” said Charles Stark, airports authority senior vice president for the Dulles Corridor Metrorail Project.  “It could be a few days earlier or a few days later. Nothing in the construction world is that exact, but you gotta have a goal, and that’s ours,” Stark said in an interview.  July 16, 2020, is a Thursday, so it is more likely that if construction sticks to the new schedule projections based on a statistical analysis and discussions with the contractors and Metro, the line would open the weekend before or after that.  The long-awaited opening of Phase 2  has been delayed a few times  , and the latest contracts with the company building the stations and tracks actually currently call for the line to be substantially completed this week. The rail yard contract called for it to be done last December.  Metro is noncommittal about the start date, despite being consulted. Several issues remain under review by Metro’s Office of Inspector General, and inspections by the independent Washington Metrorail Safety Commission also continue.  “Metro will establish a revenue start date once the project (including the rail yard) has been completed to our standards and requirements and accepted by Metro for final testing and safety certification,” spokesman Ian Jannetta said in an email.  Metro is projected to take up to two months for final testing and training of its employees once it takes over ownership of the rail line from the airports authority.  Still, Stark is looking forward to an “absolutely fantastic” feeling of seeing the line finally open in less than a year.  “After all of our examinations and statistical analysis, we are confident at this point in time — without any unforeseen situations or problems — that we will be opening in the middle of July of next year,” Stark said.  An internal airports authority report based on June data warned “continuous delays to the completion of track work could potentially impact substantial completion.”  Major construction on the yard is expected to be finished next month. Talks continue on changes likely to see the yard finished by March rather than July.  “There are a few things that they can do and some things that we can do, such as reducing review times of test reports and the final documents that are necessary to attain substantial completion,” Stark said.  The airports authority has also questioned the length of time Capital Rail Constructors, the group building the stations and main tracks, built into its schedule for fire alarm monitoring tests and generally slow construction work.  As of the end of June, the stations and tracks were projected to be substantially completed on May 14, 2020, 68 days sooner than the contractor projected just a month before.  Details of precise safety testing checklists for the new stations, tracks and rail yard are also still in negotiations. Allowing certain tests to be done simultaneously rather than sequentially could shave a significant amount of time off the schedule.  Rail yard testing has already gotten the OK to proceed in phases in order to speed things up, and the internal report projected full train testing in the rail yard will begin by the end of this year.  Safe braking testing has been completed on the tracks between Wiehle-Reston East and the first section of the tracks on the Dulles Greenway. Within the next month, safe braking and train movement testing is expected to expand along the entire line.  Dulles station windscreen fixes are still in the works, along with a number of other construction cleanup issues inspections found needed to be addressed.  Metro is currently reviewing results of core samples on a few concrete panels to ensure there were no problems with road spray exposure before protective sealant was applied.  “The results appear to be acceptable,” Stark said. “That will close out the concrete issues.”  A newly compiled list of top risks to the project — financial and otherwise — was submitted to the Federal Transit Administration on June 27.  rail-tie  and testing issues, financial claims from the contractors tied to construction delays, any new concerns raised by Metro’s safety department, potential contract litigation costs, and code compliance issues with air conditioning in elevator and escalator machine rooms.

title: Layla Moran calls air purifier availability in schools ‘paltry’
description: THE availability of air cleaning units designed to cut down on Covid cases in schools has been criticised by an MP and headteachers.
text: THE availability of air cleaning units designed to cut down on Covid cases in schools has been criticised by an MP and headteachers.     Schools with poor ventilation can apply from 7,000 units made available, following a further 1,000 Department for Education (DfE) funded units announced in November for SEND settings.      An online marketplace via the DfE provides a route to purchase units directly from suppliers, however these cost up to £1,170.     Oxford West and Abingdon MP Layla Moran labelled the 7,000 units ‘paltry’.      See also: Headteachers welcome return of face masks in classrooms     She said: “The safety of children and teachers is of paramount importance, and frankly the Government has never taken it seriously enough.     “The paltry 7,000 air purifiers announced by the Government is not enough.     “They could have already installed one in every classroom in England for around half the money they intend to spend on a new royal yacht.     “It’s time for the Government to make education a priority, instead of treating our children as an afterthought.”      Oxford West and Abingdon MP Layla Moran. Picture: Richard Cave      Rob Pavey, headteacher at Cheney School, said the Headington school is seeking alternative ways to clean the air.     He said: “None of our rooms are badly enough ventilated to qualify, but if we did, it would be major work.     “We’re doing our own tests on what is most effective and what has been having some effect is putting fans in the corner of a classroom, to blow air into the corridor, and opening fire doors to get the air flowing.     “It’s a really simple solution, which the data shows is working.     “It’s intermediate technology and nothing more than a sticking plaster though.     “What we need is professional advice and the funding for that.”     Cheney School headteacher Rob Pavey. Picture: Ed Nix      Ridgeway Education Trust oversees Didcot Girls’ School and St Birinus School – in addition to Sutton Courtenay CE Primary School and Didcot Sixth Form.     The trust’s executive headteacher Rachael Warwick said: “One of the key concerns is ventilation in schools, and it would be great if more ventilation was available.      “If we were to buy air purifiers, that expenditure isn’t refunded to schools.     “There’s a fine balance for us at the moment with the air flow as having windows open all the time makes the classroom cold and difficult for children to concentrate.”     Ridgeway Education Trust executive headteacher Rachael Warwick. Picture: David Fleming      A DfE spokesperson said: “Air cleaning units are not needed in the vast majority of classrooms – only where there is poor ventilation that cannot be easily improved.     “Based on feedback from schools that there are only very few cases where good ventilation is not possible, we are supplying up to 8,000 air cleaning units from next week.     “Together with mass testing, bringing in supply staff and the hard work of schools and teachers, we are confident that our measures will maximise classroom time for students.”

title: Sparks fire GM Penny Toler in aftermath of profanity-laced tirade
description: No description
text: The Los Angeles Sparks have fired executive vice president and general manager Penny Toler in the aftermath of a profanity-laced tirade directed at players that included a racial epithet following a playoff loss in the WNBA semifinals.  The team announced Friday that Toler, a founding member of the WNBA as a player and the Sparks’ general manager for 20 years, has been relieved of her duties immediately. Managing partner Eric Holoman will take over her duties as the club searches for a replacement.  “On behalf of ownership and the entire Sparks organization, I’d like to thank Penny Toler for a successful and historic tenure with the organization,” Holoman said. “Penny is a foundational figure in the growth of the WNBA and helped lead our franchise to perennial playoff success and multiple titles. We wish her nothing but the best moving forward.”  The Sparks said in a statement that a national search for a new general manager would begin immediately.  Toler played for the Sparks from 1997-99. During her tenure as general manager the club won WNBA titles in 2001, 2002 and 2016 while qualifying for the playoffs 18 times.  She scored the first basket in WNBA history and averaged 10.0 points, 4.0 assists and 2.8 rebounds in 88 games, 62 of which she started.  The 5-foot-8 guard from Washington, D.C., played at Long Beach State and became the 49ers’ career leader in assists and free-throw percentage at the time. She was the conference player of the year in 1988 and co-player of the year in 1989.  Dan Loumena has worked myriad jobs at the Los Angeles Times since joining the staff in 1996, including as a page designer, copy editor, assignment editor and Web producer. Loumena was part of the first group of print journalists at The Times to delve full time into the wonders of the website, helping the department move into the digital-first, round-the-clock coverage.  Washington Nationals pitcher Stephen Strasburg could forfeit a guaranteed four years and $100 million in search of a better deal on the open market this offseason.  Los Angeles Rams coach Sean McVay finally got running back Todd Gurley into something resembling an early rhythm, against the Seattle Seahawks on Thursday night.  Dodgers veteran Clayton Kershaw will start Game 2 of the NLDS against the Nationals, and if the series goes five games, he’ll be rested enough to pitch again.  Dabo Swinney makes $9.3 million per year as coach of Clemson’s two-time national champion football team. So you might think he would like to see his players paid for their work. And they are, he says. With an education.

title: यूएपीए: ‘खौफनाक कानून' के इस्तेमाल में टॉप पर है प्रदेश, योगी और भाजपा को लग सकता है तगड़ा झटका
description: No description
text: देश में 'खौफनाक कानून' कहे जाने वाले 'गैर-कानूनी गतिविधियां (रोकथाम) अधिनियम' यानी यूएपीए का उत्तर प्रदेश में जमकर इस्तेमाल हो रहा है। हालांकि विपक्षी दल 'इस्तेमाल' की जगह 'दुरुपयोग' शब्द का प्रयोग करते हैं। मुख्यमंत्री योगी आदित्यनाथ के सत्ता संभालने के बाद तो एकाएक इस कानून के तहत दर्ज होने वाले मामलों में तेजी आ गई। नए और पुराने केसों की गति में सत्तर फीसदी से ज्यादा का अंतर हो गया।   जम्मू कश्मीर और उत्तर पूर्व के राज्य भी उत्तर प्रदेश से पीछे छूट गए। साल 2017 में यूएपीए के तहत यूपी में 109 मामले दर्ज हुए थे, जिनमें 382 लोगों को गिरफ्तार कर लिया गया। अगले साल यानी 2018 में 107 केसों में 479 लोग और 2019 में दर्ज हुए 81 मामलों में 498 लोगों को गिरफ्तार कर लिया गया। विपक्षी दलों का कहना है कि मुख्यमंत्री योगी आदित्यनाथ और भाजपा, दोनों को इस कानून का दुरुपयोग अगले साल होने वाले विधानसभा चुनावों में तगड़ा झटका दे सकता है।  मामले कम व गिरफ्तारी ज्यादा, इस ट्रेंड में यूपी अव्वल है यूएपीए के तहत दर्ज मामले की जांच, राज्य पुलिस और राष्ट्रीय जांच एजेंसी (एनआईए) द्वारा की जाती है। जहां तक एनआईए का संबंध है, आतंकवाद से जुड़े मामलों के त्वरित विचारण यानी ट्रायल के लिए अब पूरे देश में अब तक 48 विशेष अदालतों का गठन किया गया है। अगर यूपी की ही बात करें तो 2015 में महज छह केस दर्ज किए गए थे। इनमें 23 व्यक्ति गिरफ्तार हुए। इससे अगले साल यानी 2016 में 10 केस दर्ज हुए, जिनमें 15 लोग गिरफ्तार किए गए। साल 2017 में 109 केस दर्ज हुए, जिनमें 382 लोगों को पकड़ कर जेल में डाल दिया गया।   इसके अगले वर्ष यानी 2018 में 479 और 2019 में 498 लोगों को गिरफ्तार कर लिया गया। यूपी में चार वर्षों के दौरान यूएपीए के 313 केस दर्ज हुए हैं। इनमें 1397 लोगों को गिरफ्तार किया गया। असम में 2015 के दौरान 103 केस में 128 गिरफ्तारी, 2016 में 216 मामलों में 219 गिरफ्तार, 2017 में 133 केसों में 374 गिरफ्तार, 2018 के 308 केसों में 170 गिरफ्तार और 2019 में 87 केसों के तहत 112 लोग गिरफ्तार किए गए। जम्मू कश्मीर में यूएपीए के अंतर्गत 2015 से लेकर 2019 तक 876 केस दर्ज हुए थे। इनमें 505 लोगों की गिरफ्तारी हुई।   झारखंड में यूएपीए के तहत चार वर्षों के दौरान 415 केसों में 516 लोगों को गिरफ्तार कर लिया गया। तमिलनाडु में चार वर्ष में 278 केस दर्ज थे। इनमें 328 लोगों की गिरफ्तारी हुई। मणिपुर में इस अवधि के दौरान यूएपीए के तहत 1796 केस दर्ज किए गए, जिनमें 2158 लोगों को पकड़कर जेल में डाल दिया गया। केरल में 145 मामले दर्ज हुए हैं। इनमें 85 लोगों की गिरफ्तारी हुई है। इसी तरह बिहार में चार वर्ष के दौरान 203 केस दर्ज किए गए, जिनमें 567 लोगों को गिरफ्तार किया गया।  वर्ष 2019 की एनसीआरबी रिपोर्ट के मुताबिक, यूएपीए के तहत एक साल में गिरफ्तार किए गए व्यक्तियों की कुल संख्या 1948 है। इस कानून के अंतर्गत साल 2016 से लेकर 2019 तक 5922 गिरफ्तार किए गए थे। खास बात है कि इनमें से केवल 132 व्यक्तियों पर दोष साबित हो सका। इससे पता चलता है कि यूएपीए का दुरुपयोग हो रहा है। यूपी के पूर्व पुलिस महानिदेशक (डीजीपी), विक्रम सिंह ने इस मामले में कहा है कि यूएपीए एक बहुत ही संवेदनशील कानून है। इसे बहुत ही सावधानी के साथ लागू किया जाना चाहिए। इस कानून का किसी भी तरह का दुरुपयोग, बहुत गंभीर परिणाम दे सकता है। कानून का दुरुपयोग इसकी पवित्रता को कम करने के लिए काफी है। इस कानून के तहत सैकड़ों लोगों को गिरफ्तार करने के लिए एक अनिवार्य कारण होना चाहिए। पूर्व आईपीएस वीएन सिंह भी कह चुके हैं कि ऐसे कठोर कानून का नियमित आधार पर इस्तेमाल ठीक नहीं है। इससे दुरुपयोग की संभावना बनी रहती है। यूएपीए का इस्तेमाल बहुत ही दुर्लभ मामलों में किया जाना चाहिए। यूपी में इसके नियमित इस्तेमाल से कानून व्यवस्था में कोई सुधार नहीं हुआ है। बेगुनाह लोगों पर यूएपीए लगाना गलत है। उमर खालिद सहित कई एक्टिविस्ट और सामाजिक हस्तियां इस एक्ट के तहत जेल जा चुकी हैं। मानव अधिकार कार्यकर्ता डॉक्टर बिनायक सेन, दलित अधिकारों के लिए काम करने वाले सुधीर धवाले, आदिवासियों की भलाई में जुटे महेश राउत और मशहूर कवि वरवर राव को यूएपीए के तहत गिरफ्तार किए गए थे। इतना ही नहीं, आदिवासी अधिकारों के लिए आवाज उठाने वाली सुधा भारद्वाज व रिसर्च स्कॉलर रोना विल्सन पर भी केस दर्ज किया गया। यूपी कांग्रेस के अध्यक्ष अजय लल्लू बताते हैं, मुख्यमंत्री योगी आदित्यनाथ इस कानून का दुरुपयोग कर रहे हैं। राजनीतिक खुन्नस निकालने के लिए इसी खौफनाक कानून का सहारा लिया जा रहा है। अगले चुनाव में यूपी की जनता भाजपा और योगी, दोनों को सबक सिखाने के लिए तैयार बैठी है। यूपी में मामले कम दर्ज होते हैं, लेकिन उनमें सैकड़ों बेकसूर लोगों को जेलों में डाल दिया जाता है। यूएपीए का जमकर दुरुपयोग हो रहा है।  यह कानून 1967 में लाया गया था। 2019 में इसमें कई संशोधन कर दिए गए। अब संस्थाओं को ही नहीं, बल्कि व्यक्तियों को भी आतंकवादी घोषित किया जा सकता है।इसके लिए उस व्यक्ति का किसी आतंकी संगठन से संबंध दिखाना भी जरूरी नहीं है। यूएपीए के तहत देश और देश के बाहर गैरकानूनी गतिविधियों को रोकने के मकसद से कई बेहद सख्त प्रावधान किए गए हैं। इस कानून के तहत केस में अग्रिम जमानत नहीं मिल सकती। किसी भी भारतीय या विदेशी के खिलाफ इस कानून के तहत केस चल सकता है। अपराध कहां पर हुआ है, इससे कोई फर्क नहीं पड़ता। विदेशी धरती पर अपराध किए जाने के मामले में भी इसके तहत मुकदमा दर्ज हो सकता है। यह कानून एनआईए को अधिकार देता है कि वह किसी तरह की आतंकी गतिविधि में शामिल संदिग्ध को आतंकी घोषित कर सकती है। पहले यह व्यवस्था थी कि आतंकवाद के किसी भी मामले में संपत्ति अटैच करने की कार्यवाही जांच अधिकारी बिना डीजीपी की अनुमति लिए नहीं कर सकता था। अब एनआईए का जांच अफसर सिर्फ एनआईए के डीजी की इजाजत लेकर कार्रवाई कर सकता है। इस कानून में सात साल तक की कैद का प्रावधान है। गैर कानूनी या आतंकी गतिविधि में किसी की जान जाती है तो आरोपी की सजा उम्र कैद या मृत्युदंड भी हो सकती है।    विस्तार   देश में 'खौफनाक कानून' कहे जाने वाले 'गैर-कानूनी गतिविधियां (रोकथाम) अधिनियम' यानी यूएपीए का उत्तर प्रदेश में जमकर इस्तेमाल हो रहा है। हालांकि विपक्षी दल 'इस्तेमाल' की जगह 'दुरुपयोग' शब्द का प्रयोग करते हैं। मुख्यमंत्री योगी आदित्यनाथ के सत्ता संभालने के बाद तो एकाएक इस कानून के तहत दर्ज होने वाले मामलों में तेजी आ गई। नए और पुराने केसों की गति में सत्तर फीसदी से ज्यादा का अंतर हो गया।      जम्मू कश्मीर और उत्तर पूर्व के राज्य भी उत्तर प्रदेश से पीछे छूट गए। साल 2017 में यूएपीए के तहत यूपी में 109 मामले दर्ज हुए थे, जिनमें 382 लोगों को गिरफ्तार कर लिया गया। अगले साल यानी 2018 में 107 केसों में 479 लोग और 2019 में दर्ज हुए 81 मामलों में 498 लोगों को गिरफ्तार कर लिया गया। विपक्षी दलों का कहना है कि मुख्यमंत्री योगी आदित्यनाथ और भाजपा, दोनों को इस कानून का दुरुपयोग अगले साल होने वाले विधानसभा चुनावों में तगड़ा झटका दे सकता है।           मामले कम व गिरफ्तारी ज्यादा, इस ट्रेंड में यूपी अव्वल है यूएपीए के तहत दर्ज मामले की जांच, राज्य पुलिस और राष्ट्रीय जांच एजेंसी (एनआईए) द्वारा की जाती है। जहां तक एनआईए का संबंध है, आतंकवाद से जुड़े मामलों के त्वरित विचारण यानी ट्रायल के लिए अब पूरे देश में अब तक 48 विशेष अदालतों का गठन किया गया है। अगर यूपी की ही बात करें तो 2015 में महज छह केस दर्ज किए गए थे। इनमें 23 व्यक्ति गिरफ्तार हुए। इससे अगले साल यानी 2016 में 10 केस दर्ज हुए, जिनमें 15 लोग गिरफ्तार किए गए। साल 2017 में 109 केस दर्ज हुए, जिनमें 382 लोगों को पकड़ कर जेल में डाल दिया गया।   इसके अगले वर्ष यानी 2018 में 479 और 2019 में 498 लोगों को गिरफ्तार कर लिया गया। यूपी में चार वर्षों के दौरान यूएपीए के 313 केस दर्ज हुए हैं। इनमें 1397 लोगों को गिरफ्तार किया गया। असम में 2015 के दौरान 103 केस में 128 गिरफ्तारी, 2016 में 216 मामलों में 219 गिरफ्तार, 2017 में 133 केसों में 374 गिरफ्तार, 2018 के 308 केसों में 170 गिरफ्तार और 2019 में 87 केसों के तहत 112 लोग गिरफ्तार किए गए। जम्मू कश्मीर में यूएपीए के अंतर्गत 2015 से लेकर 2019 तक 876 केस दर्ज हुए थे। इनमें 505 लोगों की गिरफ्तारी हुई।   झारखंड में यूएपीए के तहत चार वर्षों के दौरान 415 केसों में 516 लोगों को गिरफ्तार कर लिया गया। तमिलनाडु में चार वर्ष में 278 केस दर्ज थे। इनमें 328 लोगों की गिरफ्तारी हुई। मणिपुर में इस अवधि के दौरान यूएपीए के तहत 1796 केस दर्ज किए गए, जिनमें 2158 लोगों को पकड़कर जेल में डाल दिया गया। केरल में 145 मामले दर्ज हुए हैं। इनमें 85 लोगों की गिरफ्तारी हुई है। इसी तरह बिहार में चार वर्ष के दौरान 203 केस दर्ज किए गए, जिनमें 567 लोगों को गिरफ्तार किया गया।      5922 में से केवल 132 व्यक्तियों पर दोष साबित हुआ    वर्ष 2019 की एनसीआरबी रिपोर्ट के मुताबिक, यूएपीए के तहत एक साल में गिरफ्तार किए गए व्यक्तियों की कुल संख्या 1948 है। इस कानून के अंतर्गत साल 2016 से लेकर 2019 तक 5922 गिरफ्तार किए गए थे। खास बात है कि इनमें से केवल 132 व्यक्तियों पर दोष साबित हो सका। इससे पता चलता है कि यूएपीए का दुरुपयोग हो रहा है। यूपी के पूर्व पुलिस महानिदेशक (डीजीपी), विक्रम सिंह ने इस मामले में कहा है कि यूएपीए एक बहुत ही संवेदनशील कानून है। इसे बहुत ही सावधानी के साथ लागू किया जाना चाहिए। इस कानून का किसी भी तरह का दुरुपयोग, बहुत गंभीर परिणाम दे सकता है। कानून का दुरुपयोग इसकी पवित्रता को कम करने के लिए काफी है। इस कानून के तहत सैकड़ों लोगों को गिरफ्तार करने के लिए एक अनिवार्य कारण होना चाहिए। पूर्व आईपीएस वीएन सिंह भी कह चुके हैं कि ऐसे कठोर कानून का नियमित आधार पर इस्तेमाल ठीक नहीं है। इससे दुरुपयोग की संभावना बनी रहती है। यूएपीए का इस्तेमाल बहुत ही दुर्लभ मामलों में किया जाना चाहिए। यूपी में इसके नियमित इस्तेमाल से कानून व्यवस्था में कोई सुधार नहीं हुआ है। बेगुनाह लोगों पर यूएपीए लगाना गलत है।    कई हस्तियों को यूएपीए के तहत जेल में डाला गया है    उमर खालिद सहित कई एक्टिविस्ट और सामाजिक हस्तियां इस एक्ट के तहत जेल जा चुकी हैं। मानव अधिकार कार्यकर्ता डॉक्टर बिनायक सेन, दलित अधिकारों के लिए काम करने वाले सुधीर धवाले, आदिवासियों की भलाई में जुटे महेश राउत और मशहूर कवि वरवर राव को यूएपीए के तहत गिरफ्तार किए गए थे। इतना ही नहीं, आदिवासी अधिकारों के लिए आवाज उठाने वाली सुधा भारद्वाज व रिसर्च स्कॉलर रोना विल्सन पर भी केस दर्ज किया गया। यूपी कांग्रेस के अध्यक्ष अजय लल्लू बताते हैं, मुख्यमंत्री योगी आदित्यनाथ इस कानून का दुरुपयोग कर रहे हैं। राजनीतिक खुन्नस निकालने के लिए इसी खौफनाक कानून का सहारा लिया जा रहा है। अगले चुनाव में यूपी की जनता भाजपा और योगी, दोनों को सबक सिखाने के लिए तैयार बैठी है। यूपी में मामले कम दर्ज होते हैं, लेकिन उनमें सैकड़ों बेकसूर लोगों को जेलों में डाल दिया जाता है। यूएपीए का जमकर दुरुपयोग हो रहा है।     2019 में हुए संशोधन से यूएपीए कानून 'कठोर' बन गया है    यह कानून 1967 में लाया गया था। 2019 में इसमें कई संशोधन कर दिए गए। अब संस्थाओं को ही नहीं, बल्कि व्यक्तियों को भी आतंकवादी घोषित किया जा सकता है।इसके लिए उस व्यक्ति का किसी आतंकी संगठन से संबंध दिखाना भी जरूरी नहीं है। यूएपीए के तहत देश और देश के बाहर गैरकानूनी गतिविधियों को रोकने के मकसद से कई बेहद सख्त प्रावधान किए गए हैं। इस कानून के तहत केस में अग्रिम जमानत नहीं मिल सकती। किसी भी भारतीय या विदेशी के खिलाफ इस कानून के तहत केस चल सकता है। अपराध कहां पर हुआ है, इससे कोई फर्क नहीं पड़ता। विदेशी धरती पर अपराध किए जाने के मामले में भी इसके तहत मुकदमा दर्ज हो सकता है। यह कानून एनआईए को अधिकार देता है कि वह किसी तरह की आतंकी गतिविधि में शामिल संदिग्ध को आतंकी घोषित कर सकती है। पहले यह व्यवस्था थी कि आतंकवाद के किसी भी मामले में संपत्ति अटैच करने की कार्यवाही जांच अधिकारी बिना डीजीपी की अनुमति लिए नहीं कर सकता था। अब एनआईए का जांच अफसर सिर्फ एनआईए के डीजी की इजाजत लेकर कार्रवाई कर सकता है। इस कानून में सात साल तक की कैद का प्रावधान है। गैर कानूनी या आतंकी गतिविधि में किसी की जान जाती है तो आरोपी की सजा उम्र कैद या मृत्युदंड भी हो सकती है।

title: NYPD arrests 2nd suspect in shooting of 10-year-old Justin Wallace in Queens
description: The NYPD has arrested a second suspect in connection with the Saturday night shooting of a 10-year-old boy in Queens’ Far Rockaway community.
text: Fox News Flash top headlines are here. Check out what's clicking on Foxnews.com.The NYPD has arrested a second suspect in connection with the Saturday night shooting death of a 10-year-old boy in Queens’ Far Rockaway community.Justin Wallace was shot and killed and his adult cousin was injured after surveillance video showed a man shooting multiple rounds from a handgun through their front door.One of the bullets tore into Justin’s chest, and he succumbed to the injury at a hospital. He would have turned 11 years old on Tuesday, according to Mayor Bill de Blasio.Officers on Friday executed a search warrant at a home on Beach 45th Street, where they arrested Ashram "Kevin" Lochan, 26, and recovered multiple firearms – and a 37mm flare launcher. He has been charged with criminal possession of a weapon.It was not immediately clear what role he played in the incident.SUSPECT ARRESTED IN FATAL SHOOTING OF 10-YEAR-OLD NYC BOY       Police said they recovered these weapons from Lochan's residence. (NYPD)       Police said earlier this week they arrested the suspected gunman, 29-year-old Jovan Young, in connection with the case. His charges include murder and criminal possession of a weapon.       Jovan Young, the suspected gunman. (FOX 5 New York)       Justin’s father Albert Wallace, 57, told the New York Post he was in the basement when he heard the gunshots. He went upstairs to find his sixth-grader unresponsive in a puddle of blood.He said that the shooting came after a longstanding dispute between his family and their neighbors over a shared driveway."He kill[ed] my son over the driveway," he told the paper.Justin was one of four people killed in more than a dozen shootings in New York City over the weekend.CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APPShootings in the NYPD’s 101st Precinct, which includes Far Rockaway, are actually down by around 30% so far this year compared to last, according to department statistics. But murders are up, four as of last week compared to three in 2020.Fox News’ Maria Paronich contributed to this report.

title: Buschmann skeptisch über Wiedereinführung der Maskenpflicht
description: Justizminister Marco Buschmann (FDP) sieht eine mögliche Wiedereinführung der Maskenpflicht skeptisch. Ihr Nutzen sei noch nicht ausreichend wissenschaftlich erwiesen, meint er. Er ist auch gegen Corona-Lockdowns und Schulschließungen.
text: Buschmann skeptical of reintroduction of Maskenpflicht

title: Man City player ratings vs Brentford as Joao Cancelo and Ilkay Gundogan poor
description: Manchester City were beaten in injury-time by Brentford on a frustrating afternoon when too many players underperformed.
text: Ederson Made some good saves early on with City under pressure and was called into action on several occasions in the second half. Big late save to deny Toney. 7 John Stones Didn't make much use of the possession he had and was troubled defensively, by Henry down Brentford's left and from long balls. 5 Manuel Akanji Outjumped by Ben Mee in the lead-up to Brentford's goal and given a tough time by the excellent Ivan Toney. 5  READ MORE: City vs Brentford as it happened  Aymeric Laporte Wasn't great for Toney's goal, but played better after having his head strapped and made one brilliant clearance in the second half when a goal looked certain. 7 Joao Cancelo Lacked his usual playmaking quality from left back. Link with Foden wasn't as natural as it's been with others. Booked for diving late on. 5 Rodri Told off by Guardiola for one backwards pass than put Akanji under pressure and was never at his best. 6 Ilkay Gundogan Couple of loose passes and heavy touches in the first half set the tone for City's struggles. Had to do better with a second-half chance and then let Toney in front of him for the dramatic late winner. 4 Kevin De Bruyne Had his fair share of injury disappointment during tournament football so hard to blame him for being cautious, but bar one spell in the first half he was fairly quiet. 6 Bernardo Silva Bright down the left and almost won a penalty with one fine flick past Henry. Nimble footwork kept Brentford on their toes. 7 Phil Foden Started like he was lacking rhythm, which was understandable after his recent lack of action, but took his goal quite brilliantly. 7 Erling Haaland Have to wonder how fit he was. Did his best to reach a couple of crosses that were just too heavy and did set Gundogan up for a golden chance, but didn't carry his usual threat. 6  Substitutes  Julian Alvarez Had one chance on the breakaway but delayed a decision too long and then passed the ball behind Haaland. 5   READ NEXT:

title: Importance of local sports evident during pandemic
description: By Cole Parkinson Sports Reporter Ever since the pandemic hit Alberta last March, local sports have been in flux. Many seasons saw cancellations early on including the competitive swim season, hockey, basketball and many others. While baseball was allowed to proceed later in the summer, it was still a truncated season compared to seasons prior....
text: Importance of local sports evident during pandemicPosted on March 2, 2021 by Sunny South NewsSunny South photo by Nikki JamiesonBy Cole Parkinson Sports Reporter Ever since the pandemic hit Alberta last March, local sports have been in flux. Many seasons saw cancellations early on including the competitive swim season, hockey, basketball and many others. While baseball was allowed to proceed later in the summer, it was still a truncated season compared to seasons prior. Heading into the fall, while it was hopeful sports in southern Alberta would return to normal, that wasn’t the case. Hockey did get a soft launch early in the fall, but it was short-lived, as further restrictions would come down from the province. Central Alberta Hockey League and southern Alberta teams were able to get in a handful of games into November, but after the provincial government made the call to bring stricter measures back into place, it effectively stopped local hockey until the New Year. The biggest heartbreak across hockey was for graduating players who were not able to complete their minor hockey careers. “I hope there is a meaningful season after this break and our players get the opportunity to compete. It would be a shame if our third-year players did not get the opportunity to finish their minor hockey careers properly,” said Lynn Degenstein, head coach of the U18 Taber Golden Suns. Minor hockey associations also expressed their disappointment Grade 12 players did not have a chance to finish strong in their minor hockey careers. “For us, that’s probably been the most devastating thing. We have a number of kids in our association, and we merged with Picture Butte for our U18 group. So between Picture Butte and Coaldale minor hockey, we have several kids who are in their last year. I know a lot of kids came back this year to be able to play with their friends and have that last chance to play. Our association was hoping to bid on provincials this year for U18, like last year when we put in a bid. We feel bad for those kids. We do hope Hockey Alberta creates some opportunities for them to have another year of organized hockey, whether it’s a Junior C season or something. But that’s up to Hockey Alberta to decide,” stated Darren Hurt, Coaldale Minor Hockey president. Football was allowed to play games against teams in their own zone — which gave kids the chance to further develop their skills on the gridiron. And while it was far from a regular season, it was still an overall success considering the circumstances. “This was a season that required a lot more hoop-jumping than any other I’ve been involved in, but in the end, with the help of a fantastic group of volunteers, we were able to give the kids a chance to get out on the field and play,” said Jason Jensen, Taber Minor Football president. “With all they’ve been through with this pandemic, I think that was something that was dearly needed, and made all the hard work worth it. I’d call that a successful year.” Other sports last fall weren’t so lucky. School court sports, gymnastics and figure skating all saw difficulties in getting off the ground due to the pandemic. The lack of local sports has been devastating for kids who count down the days until their perspective sport rolls around and being cooped up for months in a row was not something anybody wanted. But during this time, it’s a great opportunity to reflect on how much local sports mean to small communities in southern Alberta. In Coaldale, the Copperheads mean so much to the community. Just walk into the Snakepit on a Saturday night and tell me the community doesn’t love that team. In Taber, football season is massive and the Ken McDonald Sports Complex is packed for W.R. Myers Rebels games every single game. And Vauxhall has the Academy Jets. Their home tournament near the end of the spring season sees tons of the community come out and support the team. It’s not just about having kids go out and play the game they love, it’s also about each community rallying around one team. And without that over the past several years, it feels like a piece is missing. Now, with restrictions starting to lift slightly and vaccines on the way, the hope to have sports back at the local level is starting to feel like it’s on the horizon. And when it does, don’t hesitate to get out there and support your local teams and athletes. I can guarantee they will be fired up to finally get out there and having the support of the community may be the highlight of many of their sporting careers.

title: Ein Feuerwehrmann und seine Trompete bewegen das Internet
description: Das Panorama im bayerischen Chiemgau ist für sich schon atemberaubend. Die Freiwillige Feuerwehr des Ortes Aschau hat jetzt nochmal einen drauf gesetzt: Ein Trompete spielender Feuerwehrmann auf einer Drehleiter berührt die Netzgemeinde.
text: The panorama is in itself in the bavarian chiemgau the volunteer fire brigade of the place has atemberaubend. again now amongst them a aschau playing trumpet on a turntable ladder gesetzt: fireman touches the Netzgemeinde. © axelSpringer Se. all rights vorbehalten.

title: Apple Pay launches soon in Argentina and Peru
description: Apple has confirmed it will be expanding
text: Apple has confirmed it will be expanding Apple Pay in Latin America in the near future, with banks in Argentina and Peru set to join Apple's mobile payments platform soon.  On January 10, Peru's Interbank briefly said it started to support Apple Pay, before pulling down any mentions of the account feature. One week later, Apple has started to promote its arrival.  An update to the Apple Pay page on Apple's Latin America regional website includes text translating to "Soon in Argentina and Peru." Apple doesn't state when it will arrive, but the Interbank misfire indicates it could be more imminent than Apple's website lets on.  Currently, Apple's list of regions that support Apple Pay states for Latin America and the Caribbean that it is available in Colombia, Costa Rica, Brazil, and Mexico. When the expansion occurs, Argentina and Peru will be added to the list.  Previously, Apple launched Apple Pay in Azerbaijan, Colombia, and Costa Rica in November 2021.

title: Tres senadores de Morena dan positivo a Covid: uno es de Quintana Roo
description: No description
text: CIUDAD DE MÉXICO.- Los senadores José Luis Pech, Maria Celeste Sánchez y Bertha Caraveo de Morena, informaron que tienen coronavirus.    José Luis Pech, legislador por Quintana Roo, dio a conocer mediante redes sociales sobre su estado de salud y confirmó sentirse bien; asimismo dijo que trabajará desde su casa. En el mensaje recomendó: "Cuidarse todos".         Por su parte, la senadora por Chihuahua, Bertha Caraveo también dio a conocer que había dado positivo a Covid.     La legisladora dijo que no presentaba síntomas y que se realizará otra prueba para confirmar el resultado.         Por otra parte Maria Celeste Sánchez, senadora de la CDMX, también anunció su resultado. Maria Celeste dijo no tener síntomas, pero seguirá trabajando en su casa.         Este miércoles Damián Zepeda y Alejandra Reynoso del PAN también anunciaron que dieron positivo a Covid.          La semana pasada resultó contagiada la legisladora panista, Josefina Vázquez Mota. Mientras que el 24 de octubre falleció por Covid, el senador de Morena, Joel Molina.

title: SpaceX Test-Fires Used Falcon 9 Rocket for Hefty Satellite Launch
description: SpaceX fired up a twice-used Falcon 9 rocket Friday (Dec. 13), setting the stage for the launch of a a hefty next communications satellite into space next week.
text: A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket will launch the JCSAT 18/Kacific 1 communications satellite from Cape Canaveral Air Force Station in Florida on Dec. 16, 2019.  (Image: © Kacific)  SpaceX  conducted the Falcon 9 test at Space Launch Complex 40 at Cape Canaveral Air Force Station here ahead of a planned launch on Monday (Dec. 16). The two-stage Falcon 9 will carry the  JCSAT 18/Kacific 1 commercial communications  satellite into space. Liftoff is scheduled for sometime during a planned 88-minute launch window on Monday from 7:10 p.m. to 8:38 p.m. EST (0010-0138 GMT Tuesday).  Friday's occurred at about 1:20 p.m. EST (1820 GMT), when the Falcon 9 rocket roared to life, as smoke billowed from its engines during the preflight test. The brief ignition, known as a static-fire test, is a standard part of prelaunch procedures and one of the last major milestones before liftoff.   During the test, the rocket's first stage is held down while its engines are briefly fired, allowing crews to ensure that all systems are working properly and that the rocket is ready to fly. Shortly after the test,  SpaceX tweeted  that the it was a success and that the company planned to launch on Dec. 16.  Tucked inside the rocket’s nose cone is a massive communications satellite that will provide broadband coverage to Japan and the Pacific Islands. Built by Boeing, the 15,335-pound (6,956-kilogram) satellite will maneuver itself to a spot in geostationary orbit, 22,00 miles (36,000 kilometers above the Earth’s equator, after it separates from the Falcon’s upper stage.  “Kacific1 will deliver high-speed broadband services to previously unserved or under-served people in nations where populations are widely dispersed, and therefore expensive to connect,"company officials said in  . "Many of these nations are archipelagos or have rugged mountain ranges and large rural territories, making satellite technology the best – and sometimes only – way to connect to the internet and phone networks."  The services provided by the satellite will be especially beneficial to health and education workers in provinces and villages across the South Pacific. Additionally, the broadband access will provide critical communications channels to a region which is often ravaged by natural disasters, such as earthquakes and tsunamis.

title: 外籍機師專用通道、專車接送 莊人祥：確診恐加重台醫療負擔
description: No description
text: 中央流行疫情指揮中心指揮官陳時中認為，這次華航機師染疫事件，很可能是外籍機師在入境時把病毒帶進來，入住諾富特飯店後導致病毒留在房間，引發後續的傳播鏈。外界質疑，為什麼外籍機師入境時不做採檢，對此，指揮中心認為，外籍機師沒採檢必要，因為他們從機場移動到檢疫旅館的過程，都有專用通道和專車，再來若是驗出外籍機師陽性確診，很可能就得留在台灣接受治療，恐怕增加我國醫療負擔，也會導致原定的飛機飛不走。外籍機師不用採檢 專家憂成防疫破口據了解，外籍機師入境時不用做採檢，對照本國籍機師，不僅在外站需做抗原檢測，回國後還得做核酸檢驗，讓外界引發質疑，更有專家擔憂恐怕成為我國防疫破口。指揮中心趕緊澄清，因為一般來說，外籍機師飛抵台灣，在機場就有專用通道，隨後也會搭乘專車直達防疫旅館，休息1到3天後就會飛離台灣，發言人莊人祥則補充，因為外籍機師是過境不入境，且到離台前都不會與他人接觸，因此沒有採檢必要，目前國際多數國家也都不會針對外籍機師做檢測。外籍機師不採檢，飛抵台灣專用通道、專車接送。圖／台視新聞莊人祥透露國外也多無檢測外籍機師。圖／台視新聞陳時中認為，外籍機師應該是說外國航空公司的機隊，指揮中心認為這兩邊的管理強度不一樣，把他們混在一起恐怕也不宜。外籍機師若採檢確診 加重台醫療負擔、班機無法離台但不採檢的關鍵因素為何？莊人祥透露，因為國外疫情相對嚴峻，外籍機師恐怕有高比例是陽性，倘若採檢確診，根據我國檢疫規定，他們就得住院治療，一來會加重台灣的醫療負擔，二來他們開的原班機，恐怕也無法離台，假設未來外籍機師有需要，才會替他們再做採檢安排。若外籍機師採檢確診，對台灣醫療負擔加重。圖／台視新聞指揮中心也補充，只要外籍機師下飛機後做好防護，採不採檢都不會對我國疫情產生影響，只是國內疫情近期無法樂觀看待，也讓外籍機師的採檢議題引發關注。台北／綜合報導 責任編輯／張碧珊

title: Potential tri-school field upgrade takes step forward
description: With tentative support from the Town of Cochrane on significant improvements to the Cochrane High field, those behind the project will now meet with Rocky View County and Rocky View Schools to confirm support. Should the town, county and school board formalize their commitments and become fully on-board, backers hope to have the project started […]
text: Breadcrumb Trail Links   News   Local News     Potential tri-school field upgrade takes step forward    Author of the article: Patrick Gibson              Should the town and county decide to get on board financially, the field between Cochrane High, Manachaban and Elizabeth Barrett might be upgraded with artificial turf that could accommodate football games. Patrick Gibson/Cochrane Times SunMedia     Article content With tentative support from the Town of Cochrane on significant improvements to the Cochrane High field, those behind the project will now meet with Rocky View County and Rocky View Schools to confirm support.    Advertisement       This advertisement has not loaded yet, but your article continues below.         Article content Should the town, county and school board formalize their commitments and become fully on-board, backers hope to have the project started in June and an artificial turf field ready for Cobras football games a year from now.  “Not only is this going to benefit the students that call the tri-school site their home, this is also going to be of huge benefit for community athletes,” said Tommy Knitter, part of a group of RVS employees facilitating the proposal on their own time. Cochrane High’s football games (and a multitude of other sporting events) are currently played at Bow Valley High’s artificial turf SLS Legacy Field. “We saw [September 10] a football game at Spray Lakes Legacy Field which hosted one thousand fans. This community is ready for a facility that is going to be the home for multiple athletic user groups.” The proposal is for the field in the middle of the ‘tri-school’ site: the Rocky View Schools-owned property along Fourth Avenue home to Cochrane High, Elizabeth Barrett Elementary and Manachaban Middle School. The school board would continue to own and maintain the field and the space would be theirs during the school day, but part of the terms of the town’s contribution would be that it serves as a community-wide space after school. “One of the benefits of [the booking system] is we are not going to be able to give preferential booking to any one particular user group,” Knitter told council. The budget is current projected at $2.4 million including the new field, uprights and scoreboard.    Advertisement       This advertisement has not loaded yet, but your article continues below.         Article content An unnamed individual donor behind the project is offering to fund $1.2 million, with the idea that the town and county would each put up $600,000. At the council meeting, however, it was indicated that the support could be withdrawn soon. “He has continuously made the comment that it has been very difficult to give a $1.2 million donation,” said Knitter. “He has made it abundantly clear to our group that if we are unsuccessful this evening and if we are unsuccessful building this facility at the end of June 2022, that he is going to remove his funding for this project.” As councillors and senior administration discussed the potential contribution and a letter sought by the backers, the idea of ‘support’ versus ‘commitment’ arose. “I think this is just a letter of confirmation, there’s no guarantee, and I think it will get them where they need to be in terms of being able to keep this moving forward,” said councillor Alex Reed. “I’m in support of this, I think this is seed money that’s necessary and needed.” His colleague Susan Flowers shared a similar sentiment. “I, too, think it’s a really great project and I’d like to see it proceed,” she said. “If there’s a way that we can write the letter that doesn’t commit us to the funding, I can only imagine the hours that they’ve put in on the side of their desks trying to make this happen and the frustration when you apply for these big grants and they all get turned down because you don’t have the commitment of your local community. So I’m all in favour if we can find a way to word it that we’re not binded.”    Advertisement       This advertisement has not loaded yet, but your article continues below.         Article content No one wanted to commit $600,000 that night, but they still had to determine what level of ‘promise’ would help the project continue to be up for consideration. “I don’t they were just here for a symbolic ‘thumbs up,’ I was getting the sense they wanted us to promise them $600,000,” said councillor Morgan Nagel. “To be clear, I think this is a great project. I think this is a great stop-gap, that Horse Creek Park and all of that sports field is a significant and amazing five to ten-year vision, but that’s not going to happen anytime soon and this would be a really good way to help those sports groups soon.” Council and staff eventually landed on wording for a “letter of support”, and that the expenditure should be considered later this year by the next council for the 2022 budget. “I made it clear to them […] I didn’t feel comfortable having them come and ask for $600,000 prior to an election, all the timing, and they were clear that all they needed was for us to be supportive of the project and that we would consider it in the budget,” said mayor Jeff Genung. Those facilitating the proposal are hoping to finalize the plan in the eyes of the school district at a Rocky View Schools trustees meeting September 23 before seeking commitment (or support) from Rocky View County at a meeting October 1.      Share this article in your social network

title: 大眾交通難保持社交距離　意外掀機車潮
description: No description
text: 美國疫情嚴峻，搭大眾運輸工具難保持社交距離，讓民眾擔心感染病毒，意外掀起一波機車潮，因為機車比汽車便宜，還能在車陣中穿梭，省時方便，尤其是紐約州，機車銷售量爆增，外媒報導，不少台灣的車款也在紐約大賣。共享機車的用量也飆升，但共享機車對駕駛員的審核標準很低，只要有汽車駕照就好，也因此交通事故頻傳。                                                                                                  紐約街頭，一輛機車呼嘯而過，機車騎士不但沒戴安全帽，雙腳踩在座椅上，甚至騎到一半，把一隻腳抬起來。還有許多年輕的紐約市民，不顧交通規則，把機車當成玩具在街上亂騎，沒有人出面制止這些危險行為。一向熱愛開車的美國，在疫情下掀起機車潮，尤其是紐約，機車便宜又能避開人，成為外送員的新交通工具，不少台灣的車款，大獲好評，銷售量翻倍。同樣受紐約客歡迎的，還有共享機車，從3月封城以來，紐約都會區的電動出租機車每天用量幾乎達到1萬8000趟。不過民眾只要有汽車駕照也能騎，審核門檻低，許多民眾在車水馬龍的紐約市亂騎車，機車事故頻傳。近期發生兩名騎士出車禍身亡後，電動出租機車公司宣布，暫停在紐約提供服務，並且調高對機車騎士的審核門檻。

title: 80 comercios rentables asi como sencillos sobre comenzar con pequeia inversion, chicas amore mio
description: No description
text: 80 comercios rentables asi como sencillos sobre comenzar con pequeia inversion, chicas amore mio Descubre 80 comercios rentables de pequeia inversion – ?y lee el consejo de oro al final! Muchos usuarios buscan comercios rentables asi como trabajos alternativos de Adquirir alcanzar cualquier objeto significativo, como                 La buena nueva es que existen varias opciones de comercios rentables Con El Fin De empezar. Sin embargo, no todo el mundo podemos realizar grandes inversiones de eso, ?no seria verdad? En caso de que te encuadras en ese grupo de seres desplazandolo hacia el pelo no precisas dinero de fabricar tu particular emprendimiento desde cero, no seria preciso que te desesperes. En este escrito, te vamos an explicar ideas sobre negocios rentables y no ha transpirado nichos sobre comercio que podrian producir ganancias significativas sin que tengas que quedar ahorrando un conjunto primero sobre dar los primeros consejos. El fin sobre este escrito es que descubras cuales trabajos puedes hacer de tener independencia financiera desplazandolo hacia el pelo acontecer tu personal dirigente empezando todavia este anualidad. En algunos casos, deberias comenzar sobre a poco y no ha transpirado, a lo extenso del tiempo, puedes convertir tu empleo en un gran empresa e tambien llevarlo a diferentes ciudades y paises. Mira las alternativas que seleccionamos y nuestros consejos para  que poseas exito en el itinerario que elijas, en sintonia con tu lateral, tus fines asi como tus habilidades. Y preparate  ?mas delante poseemos un tip de oro imperdible! VIDEO | Conoce varios sobre los negocios mas rentables de pequeia inversion en 2021 Comercios rentables  Para tener un establecimiento rentable elige un nicho en el que puedas proceder con tus conocimientos y no ha transpirado habilidades. Para ayudarte, seleccionamos las categorias mas importantes en el presente  80 negocios rentables de pequeia inversion Con El Fin De obtener independencia financiera. Nutricion  En caso de que tendrias algun ingenio culinario o conocimiento referente a alimentacion, trabajar en el sector sobre comida puede ser un gran comercio. Al fin desplazandolo hacia el pelo al cabo, a cualquier el ambiente le fascina asi como necesita consumir. Mira las ideas sobre los comercios rentables que puedes fabricar en el sector de restauracion  1. Alimento a domicilio Dar comida a domicilio seria un comercio que Jami?s sale de novedad. Lo mejor  es que nunca necesitaras gastar en la edificacion de un restaurante ni emplear a camareros o lavadores sobre platos, por ejemplo. En caso de que tu establecimiento empieza an aumentar, probablemente tendras que emplear a personal, sin embargo puedes comendar cocinando tu mismo(a) y no ha transpirado realizando las entregas, o tambien relatar con el asiento de compaiias sobre entrega como Uber Eats . 2. Alimentos congelados Los viveres congelados son la excelente eleccion Con El Fin De ejecutar mas ventas a un unico usuario, puesto que generalmente este tipo sobre producto se vende de dispendio semanal, quincenal o mensual. Este es un empresa que te facilita tener mas flexibilidad, puesto que no precisas cocinar diariamente, lo que te permite conciliar este trabajo con otras tareas. 3. Aperitivos de fiestas Este seria un hornacina que comunmente trae mucho triunfo asi como te permite inspeccionar un arsenal sobre micronichos  fiestas infantiles, matrimonios, navidad desplazandolo hacia el pelo fin de ano, quinceaneras, etc. Lo bueno sobre este modulo podria ser generalmente funciona por encargo, lo que le da mas conviccion al emprendedor o emprendedora. 4. Tortas decoradas Este segmento seria parecido al del item inicial, no obstante las tortas decoradas exigen otro tipo  de talento culinaria. Actualmente por en la actualidad esta muy sobre tendencia festejar cada uno sobre los meses sobre vida de los bebes con una pastel decorada tematica, lo que representa una gran oportunidad de comercio. Inclusive, puedes beneficiarse los lanzamientos sobre peliculas de superheroes o personajes importantes que sirven de inspiracion para las fiestas infantiles. Igualmente, fiestas sobre cumpleanos infantiles y no ha transpirado diferentes fechas especificas invariablemente disponen con este producto, desplazandolo hacia el pelo Indudablemente no faltaran usuarios. 5. Condumio Con El Fin De ninos Cada sitios de citas profesionales para solteros vez se le esta ofreciendo mas gravedad a la alimento saludable Con El Fin De ninos, ya que durante demasiado tiempo el abuso sobre azucar asi como lubricante ha estado bastante actual en los alimentos industrializados pensados para el publico pueril. Asi que, invertir en meriendas sano de los diminutos puede ser la excepcional idea sobre establecimiento rentable. Ingredientes naturales, frescos y no ha transpirado sabrosos son los mas pedidos de esta clase sobre publico. 6. Cocina internacional La cocina internacional es excepcional de mostrar un articulo que no sea de ninguna cosa obvio y no ha transpirado se distinga sobre lo que tus competidores ya ofrecen en tu localidad. Alimento japonesa, arabe, mexicana, peruana, argentina, brasilena e hindu son algunas de estas opciones que con total seguridad agradaran a tu publico. 7. Postres gourmet Los postres gourmet son pieza de los comercios rentables menos explorados y Igualmente son excelentes posibilidades de colocar a restaurantes, an estudiantes en la universidad e tambien en la paso sobre entidades en tu urbe.

title: Sue Barker breaks down in tears on Centre Court as BBC legend recovers from laryngitis to host last Wimbledon
description: SUE BARKER broke down in tears as she appeared on Centre Court prior to today’s play. The BBC legend is presenting their coverage of the Championships for the final time this year before retiring. Wimbledon honoured its former champions this afternoon, with the likes of Roger Federer, Andy Murray, Bjorn Borg and Venus Williams appearing […]
text: SUE BARKER broke down in tears as she appeared on Centre Court prior to today's play. The BBC legend is presenting their coverage of the Championships for the final time this year before retiring. 4Sue Barker was visibly moved by the tribute 4The BBC legend is retiring after the Championships 4John McEnroe paid tribute to BarkerCredit: Getty Wimbledon honoured its former champions this afternoon, with the likes of Roger Federer, Andy Murray, Bjorn Borg and Venus Williams appearing on court. Another to be presented to the crowd was John McEnroe, who in typical fashion decided to go off script. While Barker didn't win Wimbledon during her distinguished career, the American made sure to give a special mention to her on her final year presenting at the All-England Club. Barker, 66, understandably got emotional during McEnroe's tribute, looking tearful and visibly moved as she received a standing ovation from the 15,000 crowd inside a packed Centre Court.  The former French Open champion has had to shake off a bout of laryngitis to keep presenting this fortnight. Laryngitis is when the voice box or vocal cords in the throat become irritated or swollen. A BBC spokesperson said: "There are no plans for Sue to take a break and she’s poised for the Centre Court celebration [of its centenary] on Sunday." McEnroe isn't the first to pay tribute to legendary tennis player turned broadcaster Barker. ExclusiveExclusive FREE BETS AND SIGN UP DEALS - BEST NEW CUSTOMER OFFERS At Queen's, Matteo Berrettini left the former Question of Sport host in tears as he paid an emotional tribute to Barker after defending his title. Amid the presentation, the Wimbledon crowd were treated to an appearance by the 20-time major champion Federer. Appearing alongside old rivals Novak Djokovic and Rafael Nadal once again, the Swiss icon, 40, revealed that he hopes to play at Wimbledon one more time. He said: "I've been lucky enough to play a lot of matches on this court. It feels awkward to be here today in a different type of role. "It's great to be here with all the other champions. This court has given me my biggest wins and my biggest losses. "I hope I can come back one more time.  "I've missed it here. I knew walking out here last year, it was going to be a tough year ahead. I maybe didn't think it was going to take this long to come back - the knee has been rough on me. "It's been a good year regardless of tennis. We're happy at home. I didn't know if I should make the trip but I'm happy standing here right now." 4Roger Federer appeared alongside his old rivals againCredit: AP

title: MBS Day Ahead: Rising Rate Risks Are Officially Getting Serious
description: No description
text: It's Fed Day. Are you ready?  This afternoon, when markets are convulsing mere milliseconds after the Fed Announcement, MBS Live members will know what's going on before anyone else. The accuracy and speed of our real-time price stream and alerts is unmatched.  Yesterday brought a brief reprieve for bonds after the first 2 days of the week threatened to confirm a big picture shift toward higher rates (or at least to build a case for such things).  But much like the brief rally in the middle of last week, yesterday's rally proved to be a head fake, only this time, it was even less convincing.  In fact, it took place entirely within the confines of the weeks-long uptrend in rates (white lines in the chart).  Now today, bonds started out in significantly weaker territory after overnight trade headlines rocked both sides of the market (good for stocks, bad for bonds).   subscribers can get caught up with that move  HERE  .  The losses are already pushing the upper limit of the shorter-term trend.  1.90-1.94 is an important line in the sand for yields.  It separates the summertime surge from the rest of the long-term rally with a very clear high in mid-September and a very clear low in early July.  These sorts of inflection points CAN be targeted as ceilings that motivate bond buyers to get more aggressive, but they can also be lines in the sand that signify a shift into a longer term uptrend in rates.  I've been concerned about the latter ever since August's big rally.  By then, yields had fallen far enough and for long enough to put 2019 on par with many other long-term bond rallies.  To make that list, a rally needs to have covered at least 100bps.  The chart below gives examples of the market movement that has followed those rallies.  The 2 best case scenarios are seen in 2011 and 2015.  Of the two, 2011 bears more similarity to 2019.  That is worth some small consolation as we've already almost matched the initial rebound in late 2011.  If the pattern were to perfectly repeat itself (it won't, but just for the sake of argument), yields would soon drop back to recent lows and then rise back up to 1.90%-ish by March 2020.  In more dire scenarios, we're looking at another several months of weakness, and notably, in the 2009/10 example, that could be followed by another 8-12 months of volatile, sideways momentum before the next true rally emerges.  I'm not sayin this WILL happen, but it is something you need to be prepared for.  We don't know how long the weakness will last or how far it will go, but all other things being equal, the size and scope of 2019's rally make weakness more likely than strength for the rest of the year.  A former originator, Matthew began writing for Mortgage News Daily in 2007, covering a wide range of topics.
