title: طلبة كلية حقوق عين شمس فى ضيافة الإدارة العامة لمكافحة المخدرات .. صور
description: No description
text: إستقبلت الإدارة العامة لمكافحة المخدرات لعدد من طلبة كلية الحقوق جامعة عين شمس (أعضاء جمعية حقوق الإنسان التابعة للجنة الثقافية بالكلية) ومشرفيهم ، حيث تم خلال الزيارة الترحيب بالحضور ونقل لهم تحيات اللواء محمود توفيق وزير الداخلية ، والتأكيد على حرص أجهزة وزارة الداخلية على التواصل والمشاركة المجتمعية الرامية إلى التوعية من أخطار تعاطى المواد المخدرة ، وإبراز نتائج جهود أجهزة الوزارة فى مجال مكافحة وضبط القائمين على ترويجها ، فضلًا عن دور الإدارة العامة لمكافحة المخدرات التوعوى الذى تقوم بتنفيذه من خلال برامج متخصصة وحملات توعية مستمرة بمخاطر المخدرات ، سعيًا لحماية المجتمع خاصةً النشء والشباب من الوقوع فى براثن تلك الآفة . وخلال محاضرة ألقاها أحد القيادات الأمنية بالإدارة ، تم إيضاح العديد من النقاط المتعلقة بالمخدرات من بينها (التعرف على أنواع المخدرات خاصةً المستحدث منها – طرق تعاطيها - أسباب التعاطى والإدمان - تأثيرها العضوى والنفسى – كيفية تجنب الوقوع فى براثن الإدمان – القضايا الهامة التى تم ضبطها وفقًا لأحدث التقنيات الحديثة).. كما قام الطلاب بزيارة متحف الإدارة العامة لمكافحة المخدرات والذى يحوى مجموعة من الصور والمجسمات التى توضح أساليب الإخفاء والتهريب. وفى نهاية الزيارة قدم الزائرون الشكر لوزارة الداخلية لإتاحة الفرصة لتنظيم تلك الزيارة والتعرف على جهود أجهزة الوزارة للتصدى والحد من المواد المخدرة وحجبها عن المتعاطين وضبط القائمين على ترويجها. ويأتي ذلك فى إطار مواصلة أجهزة وزارة الداخلية جهودها لتحقيق رسالة الأمن لاسيما الحرص على تحقيق الأمن الإجتماعى وتوطيد أواصر الصلة والتعاون مع المواطنين لاسيما طلبة المدارس والجامعات، لغرس السلوكيات الإيجابية والوعى الأمنى لديهم، وتنظيم زيارات للمدارس والجامعات أو إستضافتهم بالمواقع الشرطية للتعرف على دور رجال الشرطة فى تحقيق رسالة الأمن.

title: فيديوجراف.. حالة الطقس اليوم الخميس 25 يوليو 2019
description: No description
text: يتوقع خبراء هيئة الأرصاد الجوية، أن يسود البلاد اليوم الخميس طقس معتدل على السواحل الشمالية، حار رطب على الوجه البحري والقاهرة، شديد الحرارة جنوبا نهارا، لطيف ليلا، وتقل الرؤية في الشبورة المائية صباحا على مناطق من شمال البلاد، كما تظهر السحب المنخفضة على السواحل الشمالية، والرياح أغلبها شمالية غربية معتدلة تنشط على جنوب سيناء وعلى خليج السويس، مما يؤدي إلى اضطراب الملاحة البحرية.  وبالنسبة لحالة البحر المتوسط تكون معتدلة، وارتفاع الموج فيه من متر ونصف إلى مترين، والرياح السطحية شمالية غربية، وحالة البحر الأحمر معتدلة، وارتفاع الموج فيه من متر ونصف إلى مترين، والرياح السطحية شمالية غربية.

title: UNC School of Medicine Novant Health Charlotte Campus receives positive evaluation from the Liaison Committee on Medical Education
description: No description
text: CHARLOTTE AND CHAPEL HILL, N.C., July 9, 2021 – The Liaison Committee on Medical Education (LCME) has determined Novant Health and UNC School of Medicine have adequate resources to proceed with training UNC School of Medicine students at the Novant Health Charlotte Campus in February 2022. This is UNC School of Medicine’s third branch campus, which will be based at Novant Health Presbyterian Medical Center in Charlotte. The UNC School of Medicine Novant Health Charlotte Campus will provide UNC curriculum to third- and fourth-year medical students, with a special focus on health equity led by Novant Health. The campus will begin with nine students and has the capacity to educate up to 30 students per class. “The UNC School of Medicine Novant Health Charlotte Campus will offer the best of both worlds by combining UNC School of Medicine’s top-notch curriculum alongside instruction from Novant Health leaders dedicated to achieving health equity,” said Dr. Pam Oliver, executive vice president and president of Novant Health’s Physician Network. “We look forward to welcoming these students to Charlotte to join our commitment to improving access to quality, affordable health care for all.” “We are extremely pleased to bring this aspect of our partnership with Novant Health closer to fruition,” said UNC School of Medicine Executive Dean Dr. Cristy Page. “We believe it will bring great benefits directly to the students who will train at the campus while enhancing care in the region. Novant Health is a strong partner for UNC, and we look forward to beginning training in a few months.”In 2020, Novant Health, UNC Health, and UNC School of Medicine reached an agreement to expand medical education, research, and clinical services to Novant Health facilities and other locations across North Carolina.                                                                                                                                 Previous articleTake Inventory            “Article and photo originally appeared on Novant Health’s Healthy Headlines. To read more, visit  HealthyHeadlines.org”

title: Monkeypox cases rise by 25% as experts warn outbreak is ‘significant and concerning’
description: Monkeypox cases in the UK are still on the rise with infections recorded in Scotland and England up to 71 since May 7.
text: The outbreak of monkeypox in the UK is being categorised as “significant and concerning” by experts as cases climbed by 24.6% since May 7.   14 fresh cases of the virus have been confirmed Scotland and England bringing the total number of cases since May 7 to 71.   The UK Health Security Agency, who play a key role in protecting the British public from infectious diseases and other health threats, has described the outbreak as “significant and concerning”.   The body confirmed the risk to the wider population at this stage is still low.   However, yesterday, it was reported that a child is believed to be in intensive care with the virus, according to Mirror Online.   Read More Related Articles    Read More Related Articles    It does not usually spread easily between people, but can be passed on through close person-to-person contact or contact with items used by a person who has monkeypox, such as clothes, bedding or utensils. An expert said superspreader events are likely to be behind the rise in global cases, with 14 different countries identifying cases, according to Harvard University. The illness has spread across the UK with a first case recorded in Scotland on May 23.       A child is thought to be in intensive care with monkeypox according to reports  (Image: Courtesy of CDC/MEGA)     Monkeypox causes a fever, headaches and a blistering rash on the face, hands and feet. It is spread by close contact. The virus is usually mild but can be more serious in kids and the vulnerable. Anyone with unusual rashes or lesions on any part of their body, especially their genitalia, is being urged to immediately contact NHS 111 or their local sexual health service.  A notable number of cases have been gay and bisexual men, so UKHSA have warned this community to be particularly alert to the symptoms. Dr Susan Hopkins, Chief Medical Adviser, UKHSA, said:“We are continuing to promptly identify further monkeypox cases in England through our extensive surveillance and contact tracing networks, our vigilant NHS services, and thanks to people coming forward with symptoms. “If anyone suspects they might have rashes or lesions on any part of their body, particularly if they have recently had a new sexual partner, they should limit their contact with others and contact NHS 111 or their local sexual health service as soon as possible, though please phone ahead before attending in person.”   Don't miss the latest news from around Scotland and beyond - Sign up to our daily newsletter here.

title: Canfor to permanently shutter sawmill near Prince George
description: Canfor Corp. (TSX:CFP) says it will permanently shutter its Isle Pierre sawmill near Prince George later this year. The company announced it will begin winding the mill down in the third quarter of this year. It cited an "insufficient supply of economically viable timber" -- the result of the mountain pine beetle epidemic -- and a global contraction in demand for lumber, as a result of the global COVID-19 pandemic, as the reasons for the decision to shut down the sawmill. The closure will take 1...
text: Sawmills like this Canfor mill in Prince George continue to shut down in the face of lower demand for lumber, high stumpage prices, shrinking timber supply and, more recently, a global pandemic. | Submitted                    Canfor Corp. (TSX:CFP) says it will permanently shutter its Isle Pierre sawmill near Prince George later this year.  The company announced it will begin winding the mill down in the third quarter of this year.  It cited an "insufficient supply of economically viable timber" -- the result of the mountain pine beetle epidemic -- and a global contraction in demand for lumber, as a result of the global COVID-19 pandemic, as the reasons for the decision to shut down the sawmill.  The closure will take 120 million board feet out of Canfor's production in B.C.  “Unfortunately, the ongoing economic devastation caused by the COVID-19 pandemic has resulted in the urgent need for Canfor to make this difficult decision,” Canfor CEO Don Kayne said in a press release.  “We know today’s announcement will have a significant impact on our employees, contractors, their families and the local communities, which we deeply regret. We will work hard to redeploy as many employees as possible to other opportunities throughout the company.”  But sawmill closures and curtailments were happening in B.C. before the COVID-19 pandemic.  In the second half of 2019, 3,000 sawmill workers lost their jobs to sawmill closures and curtailments in B.C., due to a shrinkage in the annual allowable cut, high stumpage prices and falling demand and prices for lumber in the U.S.  In addition to permanently shutting down the Isle Pierre mill, Canfor's pulp division, Canfor Pulp Products Inc. (TSX:CFX), plans to  curtail production at its Prince George Pulp and Paper and Intercontinental Pulp mills for four weeks starting July 6.  nbennett@biv.com  @nbennett_biv

title: تحويل مصر لمركز رقمى إقليمى أهم ملامح استراتيجية 2020 هدفنا الاستثمار فى البنية التحتية وتحسين خبرة العميل وجودة الخدمات المقدمة
description: قال المهندس عادل حامد العضو المنتدب والرئيس التنفيذى للشركة المصرية للاتصالات إن شركته اعتمدت موازنة عام ٢٠٢٠
text: قال المهندس عادل حامد العضو المنتدب والرئيس التنفيذى للشركة  المصرية للاتصالات  إن شركته اعتمدت  موازنة  عام  ٢٠٢٠  متضمنة عددا من المؤشرات وهى نمو إجمالى الإيرادات بنسبة ثنائية منخفضة، وهامش ربح قبل الفوائد والضرائب والاهلاكات والاستهلاكات من منتصف إلى أواخر العشرينيات، ومعدل إنفاق رأسمالى من إجمالى إيرادات  نشاط الشركة  وأضاف حامد أن موازنة المصرية للاتصالات لعام ٢٠٢٠ تعكس استراتيجيتنا لوضع الشركة كأول مشغل اتصالات وتكنولوجيا معلومات متكامل فى مصر وتحويل مصر لمركز  رقمى  إقليمى. تعمل الشركة على الاستمرار فى الاستثمار فى توسعاتها فى  البنية التحتية  والمساهمة فى المشاريع الوطنية لاقتناص جميع الفرص المتاحة فى سوق الاتصالات. كما أنها ستواصل أدائها القوى فى مجال خدمات التجزئة من خلال المحافظة على النمو فى مجال خدمات البيانات.   وأشار إلى أن الشركة قامت خلال عام ٢٠١٩ بنقلة نوعية فى مجال خدمات الإنترنت فائق السرعة الثابت من خلال إطلاق باقات «WE SPACE» مع استكمال مجموعة خدماتها لعملاء التجزئة من خلال تقديم المحفظة الإلكترونية «WE Pay». تتوقع الشركة إطلاق عدد من المشروعات خلال عام ٢٠٢٠، استكمالا للنمو المحقق خلال ٢٠١٩ مع الاستمرار فى تعظيم العائد على استثماراتها. وفيما يتعلق بنمو خدمات الجملة، من المتوقع أن يدفع نمو تلك الخدمات الطلب المتزايد على خدمات البنية التحتية من قبل المشغلين المحليين ومقدمى خدمات الإنترنت وارتفاع عائدات مشروعات الكوابل البحرية.

title: Foot - Transferts - Transferts : Pietro Pellegri quitte Monaco pour le Torino
description: L'ASM a officialisé, ce mardi, le départ de Pietro Pellegri. Prêté la saison passée au Torino, le jeune attaquant italien (21 ans) rejoint définitivement le club piémontais.

title: WH’s Klain panned for retweeting post on ‘ultimate work-around’ for federal vaccine requirement
description: Ronald Klain, the White House chief of staff, faced criticism on social media Thursday after he retweeted a post that seemed to praise...
text: WH’s Klain panned for retweeting post on ‘ultimate work-around’ for federal vaccine requirement        Ronald Klain, the White House chief of staff, faced criticism on social media Thursday after he retweeted a post that seemed to praise the Biden administration for pulling off the "ultimate work-around" for a national COVID-19 vaccine requirement.

title: 百集微纪录《红色档案》引发强烈反响：让历史档案的独特魅力鲜活释放
description: No description
text: 百集微纪录《红色档案》引发强烈反响：让历史档案的独特魅力鲜活释放                  2021-06-29 12:04:09           来源：中国新闻网           作者：梁静           责任编辑：梁静                                                                   中新网北京6月29日电   2021年，在建党百年这个有着特殊意义的重要历史节点，大量以党史题材为核心内容的影视作品集中亮相。    其中，由中央广播电视总台新闻新媒体中心策划制作的百集微纪录《红色档案》，以其扎实的档案发掘、创新的策划设计和精良的拍摄制作脱颖而出，引起社会各界强烈反响，多集内容冲进年轻人十分关注的“热搜”榜单前十名。有网友评论这个微纪录系列“因纯粹而感人至深，因真实而充满力量”。    从2021年3月8日央视新闻客户端首发《红色档案——走进中央档案馆》第一集“伟大之器”开始，这一大型系列微视频作品以每日更新的频率等先后推出了“恰同学少年”、“信仰的召唤”、“一封家书”、“狱中纪”、“为有牺牲多壮志”、“领袖的致敬”、“革命的爱情”、“以人民为中心”、“共产党员的修养”、“家风明鉴”和“永远在路上”等十一个系列共100集微视频，从多个角度生动讲述了百年间一代代共产党人始终秉承的初心和使命，以及种种宝贵精神。    6月27日，《红色档案》推出第100集《赶考与答卷》，以77年前备受毛泽东重视的《甲申三百年祭》一文和1949年3月毛泽东带领中共中央和人民解放军总部集团离开西柏坡“进京赶考”为故事看点，呈现了中国共产党人始终“不因功绩而自满、不因安稳而松懈”的精神。至此百集微纪录《红色档案》完美收官。    中央档案馆藏有数百万份建党百年间重要历史事件、重要历史人物的相关档案，极具历史价值和现实价值。《红色档案》的创作就是在深入挖掘这些珍贵档案的基础上，选取其中精华展开生动讲述，让这些尘封已久、鲜为人知的档案通过新的影像表达、新的媒介平台，向新时代的年轻受众释放出其中的独特魅力和精神力量。    以微小细节演绎伟大精神。将宏大主题化为生动而具体的故事，以小见大，见微知著；故事讲述重视局部细节，人物塑造重视微妙情感；力求将人物从观众记忆中的“英雄符号”转化为有血、有肉、有感情的“真实形象”；与此同时，还要打开空间，通过大量历史事件和不同人物的关系建构，让故事更精彩，让人物更生动，让情感更加浓烈。    《红色档案》定位于一部适合新媒体传播的、传播跨度长达近4个月的大型系列作品。在6~8分钟/集的有限时长内，《红色档案》以新媒体受众(尤其是年轻受众)乐于接受的方式，以及不同于大屏传统纪录片的全新面貌加以呈现。    在央视新闻所属客户端、微博、微信公众号，学习强国等重要官方媒体网站及全网置顶推送的大规模密集推送下，《红色档案》的新媒体传播表现尤其突出。此外，这一作品在大屏端也获得充分呈现，除在《东方时空》、《朝闻天下》持续播出外，还于近日以系列长纪录片的形式先后在新闻频道和综合频道进行播出。这一作品在众多党史题材新媒体产品中脱颖而出，社会反响强烈，各界高度好评。(完)

title: إحالة مدير مدرسة في كفر الشيخ للتحقيق
description: No description
text: أكدت مديرية التربية والتعليم بكفر الشيخ، أن تلاميذ الصف الثالث والصف الرابع الابتدائي بمدرسة المنشلين التابعة لإدارة قلين التعليمية، قد أدوا الامتحان، اليوم السبت، في مادة اللغة العربية والخط والإملاء، وأن عدد الطلاب بالصف الثالث 66 طالبًا وبالصف الرابع 84 طالبًا في 5 لجان منهم لجنة خاصة، وتغيب عن الامتحان تلميذين فقط لظروف مرضية، وتبين غيابهم من بداية العام الدراسي.  وأضافت المديرية في بيان أن المستند الذي تداوله البعض عن عدم توجه الطلاب إلى المدرسة، اليوم السبت، ماهو إلا استغاثة صادرة من أولياء أمور الطلاب لتمهيد الطريق للمدرسة، وقررت الدكتورة بثينة كشك، كيل وزارة التربية والتعليم بكفر الشيخ، إحالة مدير المدرسة للتحقيق ومجازاته.  وكان قد انتشر مستند صادر من المدرسة ممهور بختم المدرسة وموقع عليه مدير المدرسة ورئيس مجلس الأمناء ذكر فيه أن التلاميذ لم يتمكنوا من الوصول للمدرسة لأن الشوارع مليئة بالبرك ومياه الأمطار مما يصعب على التلاميذ والعاملين بالمدرسة الوصول لها، وبمتابعة أعمال الامتحانات بالمدرسة تبين عدم صحة ذلك.

title: ۲ راه ارزان برای داشتن پوستی صاف و درخشان
description: راه‌های زیادی برای داشتن پوست سالم و بدون چین و چروک وجود دارد. اما اگر به دنبال راهکاری هستید که با کمترین هزینه به خواسته خود برسید، کافی است دو نکته را رعایت کنید.
text: به گزارش همشهری آنلاین به نقل از insider، داشتن سبک زندگی سالم یک مزیت غیرمنتظره برای شما به همراه دارد: پوستی سالم و درخشان. رعایت برخی نکات می‌تواند به اندازه استفاده از محصولات مراقبتی با هزینه‌های بالا بر پوست شما تأثیر بگذارد.    دکتر ناوا گرینفیلد، متخصص پوست در نیویورک گفت که اگر می‌خواهید پوستی سالم داشته باشید، حفظ سلامتی کلی بدن به اندازه استفاده از محصولات مراقبت از پوست مهم است.    گرینفیلد می‌گوید کاهش مصرف قهوه و کافئین و ساختن عادات جدید، مانند محافظت از پوست در برابر نور خورشید و نوشیدن آب فراوان، می‌تواند از ایجاد چین و چروک جلوگیری کرده و پوست را آبرسانی کند، بدون اینکه محصولات مراقبت از پوست را در برنامه روزانه‌تان قرار دهید.    مصرف کافئین را کاهش دهید و آب بیشتری بنوشید    مصرف کافئین و قهوه در حد متعادل خوب است، اما پوست را خشک می‌کند.    گرینفیلد گفت: قهوه ادرارآور است و باعث کم‌آبی بدن می‌شود، بنابراین اگر با مصرف آب بسیار زیاد آن را جبران نکنید، پوستتان آسیب می‌بیند.    برای برخی از افراد، کم‌آبی می‌تواند غدد چربی آن‌ها را بیش از حد فعال کند و باعث آکنه و جوش بیشتر شود. برای دیگران، کم‌آبی به معنای پوست بسیار خشک است که می‌تواند منجر به پوسته‌پوسته شدن، تحریک و پیری زودرس شود. برای آبرسانی بیشتر به پوست، حداقل ۹ لیوان آب در روز بنوشید.    از پوست خود در برابر نور خورشید محافظت کنید    دکتر مونیب شاه، متخصص پوست با بیش از ۱۲.۱ میلیون دنبال‌کننده در تیک‌تاک، به اینسایدر گفت: کرم ضدآفتاب یکی از لوازم اصلی مراقبت از پوست است، اما می‌توانید لباسی را که می‌پوشید تغییر دهید تا از آسیب دیدن پوست نیز جلوگیری کنید.    گرینفیلد گفت: استفاده از کلاه، عینک آفتابی و سایر لوازم جانبی برای محافظت از تابش نور خورشید می‌تواند از پیری زودرس و سرطان پوست محافظت کند.    از کرم‌های ضدآفتاب به منظور محافظت بیشتر در برابر آفتاب، برای صورت و بدن خود استفاده کنید. با محافظت بیشتر در برابر آفتاب پوست شما در مواجهه با اشعه ماورای بنفش کمتر آسیب می‌بیند و کمتر دچار چین و چروک و تغییر رنگ می‌شود و احتمال ابتلا به سرطان پوست کمتر می شود.

title: Libya's eastern-based government resigns amid protests
description: Protesters have taken to the streets in several cities in recent days in anger over poor living conditions.
text: An interim government allied with Libya's eastern-based renegade commander Khalifa Haftar has resigned amid protests over power cuts and deteriorating living conditions.  Ezzel-Deen al-Falih, a spokesman for the Tobruk-based House of Representatives (HoR), said Prime Minister Abdallah al-Thani tendered the government's resignation to Speaker Aguila Saleh late on Sunday.  Parliamentary spokesman Abdallah Abaihig said HoR lawmakers would review the resignation of al-Thani's government, which is not internationally recognised, in their next meeting. No date has been set for the session.  Oil-rich Libya was plunged into chaos when a NATO-backed uprising in 2011 toppled longtime ruler Moammar Gaddafi, who was later killed. The country has since split between rival east- and west-based administrations, each backed by armed groups and foreign governments.  A 14-month offensive by Haftar's forces to wrest control of the capital, Tripoli, from the internationally recognised Government of National Accord (GNA) crumbled in June, with the front lines now solidified near the central city of Sirte.    The HoR on Friday accused the Central Bank and the GNA of "plundering" the country and neglecting the east, in apparent efforts to deflect blame for the deterioration of public services.  In recent days, hundreds of people have taken to the streets of Benghazi and other eastern cities to protest against crippling electricity shortages and poor living conditions, setting tyres ablaze and blocking traffic on several major roads.  On Saturday, protests also erupted in al-Marj, a Haftar stronghold.  In a statement, the United Nations Support Mission in Libya (UNSMIL) said at least one civilian had reportedly been killed and three others wounded in al-Marj. It called for "a thorough and immediate" investigation into "the reported excessive use of force against peaceful demonstrations" and the speedy release of a number of detained protesters.       The demonstrations in eastern Libya mirror similar protests in recent weeks over power cuts and corruption in Tripoli and other western cities.  UNSMIL said the protests across Libya were "motivated by deep-seated frustrations about sustained poor living conditions, shortages of electricity and water, rampant corruption, misgovernance, and a lack of service provision throughout the country".  The UN mission said the protests underscore "the urgent need to lift the oil blockade" and the return to a "full and inclusive" political process to end Libya's years-long conflict.  Powerful tribes in eastern Libya loyal to Haftar closed oil export terminals and choked off major pipelines at the start of the year to pressure the GNA.  The US Embassy in Libya said Haftar agreed to reopen oil fields and terminals no later than Saturday. By Sunday evening, it was not clear whether the blockade had been lifted.                            SOURCE:              Al Jazeera and news agencies

title: شخص يعتدي على آخر بقطعة حديد في المنصورة
description: كشفت اجهزة الامن ملابسات تداول مقطع فيديو على موقع التواصل الإجتماعى "فيس بوك" يتضمن تعدى أحد الأشخاص على آخر بقطعة حديدية بحوزته بإحدى القرى بدائرة مركز شرطة المنصورة بالدقهلية .
text: كشفت أجهزة الأمن ملابسات تداول مقطع فيديو على موقع التواصل الإجتماعى "فيس بوك" يتضمن تعدى أحد الأشخاص على آخر بقطعة حديدية بحوزته بإحدى القرى بدائرة مركز شرطة المنصورة بالدقهلية.       بالفحص تبين عدم تحرير ثمة محاضر فى هذا الشأن .. وأن طرفى الواقعة هم (طرف أول "عامل" مجنى عليه – طرف ثانى "بدون عمل" ومقيمان بدائرة مركز شرطة المنصورة بالدقهلية) وبإستدعاء المجنى عليه وسؤاله قرر بأنه تربطه صلة مصاهرة بينه والطرف الثانى وعدم رغبته فى تحرير ثمة محاضر ضده وعدم وجود ثمة إصابات به ، وأضاف بأن ( الطرف الثانى ) يُعانى من مرض نفسى ، وتم حجزه بمعرفة ذويه بإحدى المستشفيات "النفسية والعصبية" بالمنصورة .. بالإستعلام تبين صحة ذلك فتم إتخاذ الإجراءات القانونية.

title: Man fatally shot by police in Taranaki did not have a firearm
description: Police have revealed more details of the death of Kaoss Price at the weekend.
text: Supplied/StuffKaoss Price was shot by police in Taranaki on Saturday night and died of his injuries.The man fatally shot by police in Taranaki after ramming a patrol car at the weekend did not have a firearm, it has been confirmed. After ramming the police car on Saturday night, Kaoss Price, 22, had left his vehicle and was trying to commandeer vehicles from members of the public who had stopped at the scene, between New Plymouth and Waitara, police said on Thursday. “He was shot while attempting to take control of one of these vehicles,” Assistant Commissioner Sandra Venables said in a statement. “Police immediately commenced first aid; however, Mr Price was pronounced dead at the scene by ambulance staff. READ MORE: * Man fatally shot by police in Taranaki did not have a firearm * Police shooting rattles Taranaki community * Police shooting: Kaoss Price post-mortem examination has taken place  “Members of the public caught up in the incident were not injured. “Mr Price did not have a firearm and police did not recover any firearms from the scene.” Police are appealing for potential witnesses to come forward. The scene of the incident stretched about 230 metres along State Highway 3, between De Havilland Dr and Mountain Rd. Venables said exhibits requiring forensic examination included 15 vehicles and one trailer.LISA BURD/STUFFEmergency services were on Monday at the scene of Saturday's fatal police shooting on State Highway 3 north of New Plymouth. “The examination of those vehicles was completed on Wednesday. “The process of interviewing a significant number of witnesses is ongoing.” The statement said a police unit conducted a vehicle stop on a car travelling along SH3 about 9.30pm. “While police were speaking to the driver of this vehicle, Mr Price has sped past in his vehicle with the headlights off. “He has turned around and driven at high speed toward police, before crossing the centre line and narrowly missing the stationary police car. “He continued down the road before making a second u-turn and driving back toward Police, this time ramming the police car at speed. “The force of the impact shunted the police car off the road. “Mr Price’s vehicle was immobilised due to the damage sustained in this collision.” He was then shot while trying to commandeer a vehicle from members of the public. Venables statement added: “Mr Price was returned to his whānau yesterday [Wednesday] following the completion of a post-mortem. “Police and support services continue to provide support to Mr Price’s family, the community and our staff at this difficult time. “While witness interviews and other enquiries continue police are not in a position to comment further.”

title: Three parts of West Midlands where coronavirus is actually falling
description: Solihull has fallen from a rate of 247 cases per 100,000 people to 235
text: The latest coronavirus rate for each part of Birmingham and the West Midlands show three areas actually have falling case numbers. Solihull has fallen from a rate of 247 cases per 100,000 people to 235. Coventry, meanwhile, is now back below 200 cases per 100,000 people, too. The West Midlands city, situated down the M6 from Birmingham, now has 195 cases per 100k. That is down from 208 cases last week. Worcester, meanwhile, has a rate of 149 cases per 100,000 people, down from 154. The rate is expressed as the number of new cases per 100,000 people. Data for the most recent four days (October 30-November 2) has been excluded as it is incomplete and does not reflect the true number of cases. The list has been calculated by the PA news agency and is based on Public Health England data published on November 2 on the Government's coronavirus dashboard.   Read More Related Articles    Read More Related Articles    Here is the list in full. From left to right, it reads: name of local authority; rate of new cases in the seven days to October 29; number (in brackets) of new cases recorded in the seven days to October 29; rate of new cases in the seven days to October 22; number (in brackets) of new cases recorded in the seven days to October 22. title: Zimbabwe: Building Contractors, Govt Headed for Legal Showdown
description: [Zimbabwe Independent] The Zimbabwe Building Contractors Association (ZBCA) is mulling taking the government to court over loss of revenue caused by recent changes to the currency regime, businessdigest has learnt.
text: The Zimbabwe Building Contractors Association (ZBCA) is mulling taking the government to court over loss of revenue caused by recent changes to the currency regime, businessdigest has learnt.  Government in February abolished a 1:1 peg between the US dollar and the Real-Time Gross Settlement dollar's predecessor, a fiat currency called bond notes introduced in 2016 as well their electronic equivalent, and introduced the foreign currency interbank rate. Government then abolished the multi-currency regime which was introduced in 2009 through Statutory Instrument 142 of 2019 in June this year.  In an interview this week, ZBCA president Francis Mangwendeza said the shifting of goalposts by government as a result of the currency changes has shortchanged them, hence the need for a class action suit against the state.  "During the period prior to the abolition of the US dollar, contracts were denominated in US dollar. Treasury argues that contractors factored in parallel market rates into their pricing. That is true but only to a certain extent. Contracts priced in 2017 or earlier are more than likely to have been priced in US dollar than contracts priced in 2018," Mangwendeza said. "Because of delays occasioned by various factors including non-payment of claims, lack of forex to import critical inputs and other technical factors, most contracts were lagging behind schedule. As such, a substantial number of contracts were priced before 2017.  Over and above this are issues to do with other contractual claims including retention. A two-year contract priced in 2015, commenced in 2016 and completed in 2017 now has retention due in 2018."  He said they have taken legal opinion on this issue and have tried to engage the Ministry of Finance without success. This, he said, has resulted in their contemplating a class action as an industry to challenge "the said directive and relevant Act".  "It is our view that the application of this particular directive from Treasury is ultra vires one of the principles upon which law is enforced: that you cannot apply the law in retrospect.. This statutory Instrument also contradicts the contract conditions which cannot be changed in retrospect.  What we mean is that where work has been undertaken and certified based on set of conditions and legal provisions, you cannot then apply a law in retrospect that changes those conditions upon which work was undertaken," Mangwendeza said. "As such, it is our contention that all payments due for work done prior to the promulgation of the Treasury circular should be treated as intended in the contract. It is therefore only fair that work done and claims due prior to February be paid at the interbank rate."  Mangwendeza said the banning of the multi-currency regime has been badly implemented and has crippled the construction sector."The transition from foreign currency-denominated contracts to Zimdollar contracts has not been handled well enough and has threatened the viability of the industry.  The change has also caused economic instability. This makes it difficult for the industry to function," Mangwendeza pointed out. "Construction has a long payment cycle from inception of a project to its final payment to recouping investments.  This necessitates a stable economy upon which certain predictions can be made. Where the predictions and or assumptions are adversely affected due to external factors, it brings uncertainty into the project."He said the sector needs economic stability and predictability if it is to remain viable  "The currency which is used is not critical as long as it is stable and exchangeable," Mangwendeza said.  He said the sector has been adversely affected by the prolonged power outages which last up to 18 hours on a daily basis."Like all other sectors we have been adversely affected. We can no longer plan production schedules for those tasks and processes that require power.  Secondly, we are unable to get raw materials as we need them as suppliers' production, for example in cement and other products, is hampered by the lack of power," Mangwendeza said. "The lack of power also lowers investor confidence which impacts on confidence and investment in the construction sector."

title: No social distancing at Veed-en- Hoop stelling
description: No description
text: A chaotic situation broke out at Veed-en-Hoop stelling Friday evening when scores of persons gathered to travel with the boats. The passengers were travelling to Region Three and some were travelling from Region Four to Veed-en-Hoop. Most of the passengers were heading from work. Persons who travelled from Region Three to Region Four had to stand for long hours before they came off the boat. There were high tides and compounded with that over two hundred persons gathered without observing the Covid-19 guidelines of social distancing.

title: Abwrackprämie oder Zuschussmodell – Länderchefs beraten über Autoprämien
description: No description
text: Bekommt die Autoindustrie Staatshilfen - und wenn ja, wie viel und für welche Antriebe? Die Regierungschefs der Autoländer sprechen darüber. Volkswagen hat sich vor den Beratungen der Ministerpräsidenten von Niedersachsen, Bayern und Baden-Württemberg über mögliche Auto-Kaufprämien in der Krise für eine weitreichende Förderung ausgesprochen.  Man werde sich dafür starkmachen, „dass die Politik Geld für diesen Impulsstoß bereitstellt“, erklärte VW-Betriebsratschef Bernd Osterloh am Mittwoch in einem Brief an die Mitarbeiter. „Wir wissen, dass wir damit nach Steuermitteln rufen“, heißt es in dem Schreiben, das der dpa vorliegt. „Aber wir wissen auch, dass sich dieses Geld für unsere gesamte Gesellschaft klug anlegen ließe und sich so gleich mehrfach rechnen könnte – nämlich ökonomisch, ökologisch und sozial.“ Generelle Kaufprämie oder Begrenzung auf E-Autos Die Regierungschefs der drei Autoländer – Stephan Weil (SPD), Markus Söder (CSU) und Winfried Kretschmann (Grüne) – wollen sich am Nachmittag zusammenschalten. Weil hatte am Montag zum Wiederanlauf des VW-Stammwerks Wolfsburg angekündigt, ein denkbares Prämienmodell zu prüfen: „Uns ist bewusst, dass wir eine schnelle Entscheidung brauchen.“ VW-Konzernchef Herbert Diess forderte „baldige kraftvolle Maßnahmen“. Söder sagte der „Süddeutschen Zeitung“: „Ich bin für eine sehr umfassende Strategie, wie wir der Automobilindustrie helfen.“ Nach den Vorstellungen des VW-Betriebsrats sollte ein Fördermodell unter anderem eine „Impuls-Prämie“ für Neuwagenkäufe inklusive Leasing umfassen, die auch für moderne Verbrenner gilt und über „einen klar begrenzten Zeitraum“ läuft. Sie sollte ähnlich hoch sein wie die „Abwrackprämie“ in der Finanzkrise 2009 und sich auch auf junge Gebrauchtwagen bis zum Alter von einem Jahr erstrecken. Abwrackprämie zusätzlich Zudem möchte Osterloh eine „zusätzliche Abwrackprämie obendrauf“, die es für verschrottete Altautos der Abgasnormen Euro-3 und Euro-4 gibt. Die deutschen Hersteller sollten sich nach Meinung von VW einig sein, die staatlichen Mittel „je nach zugesagter Summe womöglich sogar zu verdoppeln, zumindest aber die Wechselkosten zu übernehmen“. Daneben solle der CO2-Ausstoß als Bemessungsgrundlage für die Kfz-Steuer stärker berücksichtigt werden.  Söder hatte in der vergangenen Woche erklärt, er wolle sich mit seinen beiden Kollegen aus Hannover und Stuttgart zusammensetzen, um etwa über ökologische Prämienmodelle nachzudenken und gerade der neuen Generation von Motoren und Autos nach der Phase des Durchhaltens eine Möglichkeit zu geben. Die Autobauer hatten wegen des Nachfrageeinbruchs und unterbrochener Lieferketten ihre Werke über mehrere Wochen schließen müssen – drastische Umsatzrückgänge sind die Folge. Bundesumweltministerin Svenja Schulze (SPD) befürwortet neue Hilfen für die Autoindustrie, wenn sich die Förderung „auf klimaschonende Fahrzeuge“ konzentriert. (dpa)   Eine Buchempfehlung vom Verlag der Epoch Times Wenn der Staat eine aktive Rolle in der Wirtschaft spielt, hat jede Aktion einen Dominoeffekt auf den Markt. Neue Richtlinien und Gesetze können ganze Branchen verändern und viele Unternehmen und Investoren von den Entscheidungen der Regierung abhängig machen. Der Staat, der traditionell nur Gesetze verabschiedete und durchsetzte, ist dadurch ein führender Akteur in der Wirtschaft geworden.  Der Staat ist wie ein Schiedsrichter, der bei einem Fußballspiel auch noch zum Spieler wird: Er kontrolliert und reguliert das Kapital in einer Wirtschaft, die früher privat war und ersetzt damit die „unsichtbare Hand“ durch die „sichtbare Hand“. Es gibt mindestens zwei Hauptfolgen der umfangreichen staatlichen Eingriffe. Erstens erweitert sich die Macht des Staates hinsichtlich seiner Rolle und seines Umfangs. Regierungsbeamte entwickeln zunehmend Überheblichkeit hinsichtlich ihrer Fähigkeit, in die Wirtschaft einzugreifen und den Staat die Rolle des Retters spielen zu lassen. Auch nach der Bewältigung einer Krise behält die Regierung für gewöhnlich ihre erweiterten Befugnisse und Funktionen bei – wie im Kapitel 9 des Buches „Wie der Teufel die Welt beherrscht“ analysiert wird.  Zweitens führt der Interventionismus zu mehr Abhängigkeit von der Regierung. Wenn die Menschen auf Herausforderungen stoßen oder wenn der freie Markt nicht die Vorteile bieten kann, die sie sich wünschen, werden sie sich für mehr staatliche Eingriffe einsetzen, um ihre Forderungen erfüllt zu bekommen. Hier weitere Informationen und Leseproben.  Ein Buch für alle, denen das Schicksal der Welt am Herzen liegt: „Wie der Teufel die Welt beherrscht“ – Das Kapitel 16 beinhaltet das Thema „Öko“ und trägt den Titel: „Pseudoreligion Ökologismus – Der Kommunismus hinter dem Umweltschutz“.Foto: Epoch Times ISBN Band 1: 978-3-9810462-1-2, Band 2: 978-3-9810462-2-9, Band 3: 978-3-9810462-3-6, Drei Bände 1-3: 978-3-9810462-6-7. Einzeln kostet jeder Band 19,90 Euro (zzgl. 2,70 Euro Versandkosten), alle drei Bände gemeinsam sind im Moment noch zum Sonderpreis von 50,50 Euro (kostenloser Versand innerhalb Deutschlands) zu erwerben. Das Buch hat insgesamt 1008 Seiten und über 1200 Stichworte im Indexverzeichnis. Bestellmöglichkeiten: Das dreibändige Buch ist sofort erhältlich in unserem neuen Online-Buch-Shop, bei Amazon oder direkt beim Verlag der Epoch Times – Tel.:  49 (0)30 26395312, E-Mail: [email protected] Das Buch gibt es auch als E-Book und als Hörbuch Das E-Book gibt es in den Formaten PDF, EPUB oder MOBI. Das Hörbuch bieten wir im MP3-Format zum Download an. Einzeln kostet jeder Band 17,90 Euro, alle drei Bände sind im Moment noch zum Sonderpreis von 43,00 Euro zu erwerben. title: Washington finishes strong to defeat Texas Southern 72-65
description: No description
text: Washington finishes strong to defeat Texas Southern 72-65Nov. 15, 2021Updated: Nov. 15, 2021 11:20 p.m.              SEATTLE (AP) — Terrell Brown Jr. had 20 points and nine assists, Daejon Davis added 15 points and Washington defeated Texas Southern 72-65 on Monday night.                  Jamal Bey added 10 points and seven rebounds for Washington (2-1). PJ Fuller added 11 points off the bench.                  Washington took the lead for good on a step-back 3-pointer by Fuller with 7:08 remaining in the second half. Texas Southern went the next four minutes without a point while the Huskies extended their lead to 63-56.                  The Huskies did not make a field goal in the final 4:26, instead parading to the foul line where they made 9 of 11 in the final 2:07. Overall, Washington made 20 of 28 free throws.                                                  Joirdon Karl Nicholas scored 16 points for the Tigers. Justin Hopkins added 11 points and PJ Henry scored 10. Brison Gresham had 11 rebounds and the Tigers outrebounded the Huskies 52-29.                              Texas Southern shot 36% overall and made only 2 of 18 3-pointers. Washington shot 40% overall with 6 of 22 from 3-point distance.                  —-                  More AP college basketball: https://apnews.com/Collegebasketball and https://twitter.com/AP_Top25

title: 16 معلومة عن البابا شنودة الثالث في ذكرى تنصيبه الـ49
description: No description
text: تحل اليوم السبت، الذكرى الـ49 لتنصيب البابا شنودة الثالث، بطريركًا للكنيسة القبطية الأرثوذكسية، ليكون البطريرك الـ117 في تاريخ بطاركة الكنيسة. وتستعرض "الوطن" 16 معلومة عن البطريرك الراحل: 1- اسمه الحقيقي "نظير جيد". 2- ولد في قرية سلام بمحافظة أسيوط، في 3 أغسطس 1923. 3- تخرج بكلية الآداب قسم التاريخ، جامعة القاهرة. 4- في عام 1947 التحق بالكلية الإكليريكية القسم المسائي قبل أن يحصل على بكالوريوس اللاهوت عام 1950 ويكون الأول على دفعته، ويعين مدرسًا بالكلية الإكليريكية نظرًا لنبوغه وتفوقه. 5- ترهبن في دير العذراء السريان بوادي النطرون تحت اسم "الراهب أنطونيوس السرياني"، في 18 يوليو 1954 . 6-  تتلمذ "أنطونيوس" على يد الأب متى المسكين، وذهبا معًا في دروب الرهبنة، وترشحا سويًا إلى الكرسي البابوي عام 1956، قبل أن يتم استبعادهما ويأتي البابا كيرلس السادس بطريركا للكنيسة. 7- في 10 مايو 1959 قرر البابا كيرلس السادس تعيين القس أنطونيوس السرياني في سكرتاريته. 8- في 30 سبتمبر 1962، سُيم الراهب أنطونيوس أسقفًا للتعليم باسم "الأنبا شنودة". 9. وصل الأنبا شنودة للكرسي البابوي في عام 1971 جالسًا على الكرسي البابوي. 10- كان أول بطريرك ينشئ العديد من الأديرة القبطية خارج مصر، وأعاد تعمير عدد كبير من الأديرة المتهالكة. 11- امتدت أنشطة البابا شنودة إلى الكتابة في الصحافة، وكان يكتب في جريدة "الأهرام" وكان عضوًا في نقابة الصحفيين. 12-  كتب البابا القصائد الشعرية، وكان لعدة سنوات محررًا ثم رئيسًا للتحرير في مجلة "مدارس الأحد". 13-  هو أول بابا يرسم أسقفًا عامًا للشباب وهو الأنبا موسى. 14. أتاح المجال أمام المرأة للكتابة في مجلة الكنيسة وهي مجلة "الكرازة"، حيث سمح لنبيلة ميخائيل يوسف كتابة باب "روائع العلم"، وهي نفسها أول امرأة عضوة في المجلس الملي العام منذ عام 1989. 15- أول بابا يقيم حفلات إفطار رمضانية لكبار السياسيين، وكذلك فعاليات المجتمع المصري السياسية منذ عام 1986. 16-  توفي في 17 مارس 2012 .

title: Foxconn Buys Lordtown Motors - Becomes An EV Maker Overnight
text: We knew it was going to happen and now, Taiwanese juggernaut Foxconn  has officially closed its deal to purchase the Ohio factory of Lordstown Motors. Lordstown entered the automotive space with a lot of promises but has  so far failed to live up to them. The EV startup purchased the site  from General Motors but will now transfer ownership to Hon Hai  Technology Group. In addition, Lordstown’s 400 manufacturing employees  will be transferred to Foxconn and the iPhone manufacturer will also  take on the responsibility of manufacturing the all-electric Endurance  pickup truck.Read Article

title: Russian forces left roughly 100 liters of 'high-quality vodka' at the Chernobyl nuclear plant before they retreated, Ukrainian workers say
text: Chernobyl, UKRAINE: A rescue worker sets flag signalling radioactivity in front of Chernobyl nuclear power plant during a drill organized by Ukraine's Emergency Ministry 08 November 2006. Employees and rescue workers improved their reactivity in case of a collapse of the sarcophagus covering the destroyed 4th power block.SERGEI SUPINSKY/AFP via Getty ImagesRussian forces seized the Chernobyl nuclear plant on the first day of the Ukrainian invasion.Hundreds of workers were held hostage during the occupation until the pullout in March.Workers are now left to clean up the mess Russian troops left behind — including vodka and feces.Ukrainian workers who are cleaning up the Chernobyl nuclear plant following the Russian troop withdrawal have found "high-quality vodka," The Wall Street Journal reported Monday.Hundreds of workers were held hostage at the plant for weeks after Russian forces took over on February 24 — the start of Vladimir Putin's unprovoked war on Ukraine."When the invasion started, the front guards got a call to fall back because a huge flow of Russian troops were coming," said Julia Bezdizha, a spokeswoman for the plant, told The Journal. "They fled mainly because it was very dangerous to stay and engage in heavy combat because of the heavy radiation."The Russian troops began their withdrawal in late March after having been affected by "significant doses of radiation," Ukrainian authorities previously said.Russian soldiers were reported to have dug up trenches and navigated the plant without protective gear.Radiation exposure can lead to varying short and long-term health effects — including acute radiation syndrome, cancer, and mental distress — according to the Center for Disease Control and Prevention."We believe very soon [the Russians] will feel the consequences of radiation that they have received. Some of them will feel it in months, some of them in years," Yevhen Kramarenko, head of the State Agency of Ukraine on Exclusion Zone Management, said at a press conference in April. "But anyway, all of the servicemen who were there will feel it at some point."He added that it's unclear how radiation levels have changed nearby after the site — including its radioactive soil — was tampered with.In addition to leaving behind around 100 liters of high-quality vodka, the Russian troops left a large mess at the plant, per The Journal.Ukrainian workers found human feces, smashed computer screens, and spray-painted walls throughout the plant, according to The Journal."The poop was the icing on the cake," Aleksandr Barsukov, the deputy director of the Chernobyl Ecocenter, told The Journal.The Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant did not immediately respond to Insider's request for comment.Read the original article on Business Insider

title: 80 comercios rentables asi como sencillos sobre comenzar con pequeia inversion, chicas amore mio
description: No description
text: 80 comercios rentables asi como sencillos sobre comenzar con pequeia inversion, chicas amore mio Descubre 80 comercios rentables de pequeia inversion – ?y lee el consejo de oro al final! Muchos usuarios buscan comercios rentables asi como trabajos alternativos de Adquirir alcanzar cualquier objeto significativo, como                 La buena nueva es que existen varias opciones de comercios rentables Con El Fin De empezar. Sin embargo, no todo el mundo podemos realizar grandes inversiones de eso, ?no seria verdad? En caso de que te encuadras en ese grupo de seres desplazandolo hacia el pelo no precisas dinero de fabricar tu particular emprendimiento desde cero, no seria preciso que te desesperes. En este escrito, te vamos an explicar ideas sobre negocios rentables y no ha transpirado nichos sobre comercio que podrian producir ganancias significativas sin que tengas que quedar ahorrando un conjunto primero sobre dar los primeros consejos. El fin sobre este escrito es que descubras cuales trabajos puedes hacer de tener independencia financiera desplazandolo hacia el pelo acontecer tu personal dirigente empezando todavia este anualidad. En algunos casos, deberias comenzar sobre a poco y no ha transpirado, a lo extenso del tiempo, puedes convertir tu empleo en un gran empresa e tambien llevarlo a diferentes ciudades y paises. Mira las alternativas que seleccionamos y nuestros consejos para  que poseas exito en el itinerario que elijas, en sintonia con tu lateral, tus fines asi como tus habilidades. Y preparate  ?mas delante poseemos un tip de oro imperdible! VIDEO | Conoce varios sobre los negocios mas rentables de pequeia inversion en 2021 Comercios rentables  Para tener un establecimiento rentable elige un nicho en el que puedas proceder con tus conocimientos y no ha transpirado habilidades. Para ayudarte, seleccionamos las categorias mas importantes en el presente  80 negocios rentables de pequeia inversion Con El Fin De obtener independencia financiera. Nutricion  En caso de que tendrias algun ingenio culinario o conocimiento referente a alimentacion, trabajar en el sector sobre comida puede ser un gran comercio. Al fin desplazandolo hacia el pelo al cabo, a cualquier el ambiente le fascina asi como necesita consumir. Mira las ideas sobre los comercios rentables que puedes fabricar en el sector de restauracion  1. Alimento a domicilio Dar comida a domicilio seria un comercio que Jami?s sale de novedad. Lo mejor  es que nunca necesitaras gastar en la edificacion de un restaurante ni emplear a camareros o lavadores sobre platos, por ejemplo. En caso de que tu establecimiento empieza an aumentar, probablemente tendras que emplear a personal, sin embargo puedes comendar cocinando tu mismo(a) y no ha transpirado realizando las entregas, o tambien relatar con el asiento de compaiias sobre entrega como Uber Eats . 2. Alimentos congelados Los viveres congelados son la excelente eleccion Con El Fin De ejecutar mas ventas a un unico usuario, puesto que generalmente este tipo sobre producto se vende de dispendio semanal, quincenal o mensual. Este es un empresa que te facilita tener mas flexibilidad, puesto que no precisas cocinar diariamente, lo que te permite conciliar este trabajo con otras tareas. 3. Aperitivos de fiestas Este seria un hornacina que comunmente trae mucho triunfo asi como te permite inspeccionar un arsenal sobre micronichos  fiestas infantiles, matrimonios, navidad desplazandolo hacia el pelo fin de ano, quinceaneras, etc. Lo bueno sobre este modulo podria ser generalmente funciona por encargo, lo que le da mas conviccion al emprendedor o emprendedora. 4. Tortas decoradas Este segmento seria parecido al del item inicial, no obstante las tortas decoradas exigen otro tipo  de talento culinaria. Actualmente por en la actualidad esta muy sobre tendencia festejar cada uno sobre los meses sobre vida de los bebes con una pastel decorada tematica, lo que representa una gran oportunidad de comercio. Inclusive, puedes beneficiarse los lanzamientos sobre peliculas de superheroes o personajes importantes que sirven de inspiracion para las fiestas infantiles. Igualmente, fiestas sobre cumpleanos infantiles y no ha transpirado diferentes fechas especificas invariablemente disponen con este producto, desplazandolo hacia el pelo Indudablemente no faltaran usuarios. 5. Condumio Con El Fin De ninos Cada sitios de citas profesionales para solteros vez se le esta ofreciendo mas gravedad a la alimento saludable Con El Fin De ninos, ya que durante demasiado tiempo el abuso sobre azucar asi como lubricante ha estado bastante actual en los alimentos industrializados pensados para el publico pueril. Asi que, invertir en meriendas sano de los diminutos puede ser la excepcional idea sobre establecimiento rentable. Ingredientes naturales, frescos y no ha transpirado sabrosos son los mas pedidos de esta clase sobre publico. 6. Cocina internacional La cocina internacional es excepcional de mostrar un articulo que no sea de ninguna cosa obvio y no ha transpirado se distinga sobre lo que tus competidores ya ofrecen en tu localidad. Alimento japonesa, arabe, mexicana, peruana, argentina, brasilena e hindu son algunas de estas opciones que con total seguridad agradaran a tu publico. 7. Postres gourmet Los postres gourmet son pieza de los comercios rentables menos explorados y Igualmente son excelentes posibilidades de colocar a restaurantes, an estudiantes en la universidad e tambien en la paso sobre entidades en tu urbe.

title: No-Li Brewhouse steps up to Fight Fire With Beer
description: No description
text: No-Li Brewhouse steps up to Fight Fire With Beer                                      By Kendall Jones, Washington Beer Blog       Facebook TwitterReddit    No-Li Brewhouse recently set up a program to raise funds for the Washington State Fire Fighters’ Association. Customer’s at the brewpub in Spokane simply buy a Fight Fire With Beer pint glass to support the cause. The company will donate 100 percent of the $5 price to programs that support volunteer firefighter training and support. In the end, the Fight Fire With Beer program will raise $5,000 for the cause. Here is the announcement from the brewery. No-Li Brewhouse is proud to be a community leader that supports people helping people and people protecting people! Together, across the State of Washington and Idaho we are uniting and raising $5,000 for the Washington State Fire Fighters’ Association. The $5,000 will go directly to volunteer fire fighter training and support programs for the woman & men that risk their lives to protect us. The program runs through the end of August. sponsor  No-Li is featuring a custom designed pint glass for $5 at No-Li Pub.      100% of every $5 pint glass goes directly to the Washington State Fire Fighters’ Association. This is No-Li’s third year in the partnership. We are grateful to the women and men in our communities that fight fires to protect our homes, forests, and lives. Thank you! No-Li is 100% family-owned and independent. 100% of the monies from No-Li stay right here in our home communities. Together, we are forging local craft beer making, local jobs and supporting local communities. Washington State Fire Fighters are an integral part of our communities. sponsor   Facebook TwitterReddit  For the latest news and information about beer in and around Pacific Northwest, visit Washington Beer Blog.

title: بعثة بيراميدز تغادر تنزانيا
description: No description
text: غادرت بعثة فريق الكرة بنادي بيراميدز، مساء اليوم الأربعاء، العاصمة التنزانية دار السلام في طريقها إلى القاهرة، عقب الانتهاء من مواجهة نامونجو التنزاني في بطولة كأس الكونفدرالية الأفريقية.وحقق بيراميدز فوزا كبيرا على نامونجو بهدفين دون مقابل سجلهما رمضان صبحي وعمر جابر في إطار الجولة الثانية من دور المجموعات لبطولة كأس الكونفدرالية الأفريقية.ومن المنتظر أن تصل البعثة على متن الطائرة الخاصة التي وفرتها إدارة النادي لراحة جميع أفراد الفريق إلى القاهرة في ساعة مبكرة من صباح غدا الخميس، ليحصل اللاعبون على راحة سلبية لمدة ٤ أيام عقب العودة من دار السلام.

title: Mansukh Mandaviya to address Investor Summit on October 27
text: New Delhi, October 25: Union Chemical and Fertiliser Minister Mansukh Mandaviya will address the Investor Summit Opportunities and Partnerships in Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices on October 27, i.e Wednesday at 10 am via video conferencing.     As per the Ministry of Chemical and Fertiliser, the summit will be part of the vision to further strengthen India's position globally in terms of pharmaceuticals and medical devices.The theme of the summit is "Opportunities and Partnerships in Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices".The summit will provide an opportunity for industry participants and discuss success stories from the Indian medical devices sector, end to end integration for enhancing vaccine manufacturing capabilities, financing start-up in the pharma and medical devices sector and from the ground up - deliberating on streamlining regulatory processes for investors approved under Production Linked Incentive (PLI) Schemes for bulk drugs and medical devices."As regards the Medical Devices sector, the sessions will feature discussions on how India can develop as a land of opportunities for Medical Devices and the key learnings from the leading innovators. The medical devices sector is seen as a sunrise sector and has the potential to grow from the current level of USD 11Billion to a size of USD 50 Billion in the next few years," said the ministry's statement.The PLI for Pharmaceuticals launched with an outlay of Rs 15000 crore has attracted considerable interest with about 278 companies applying to be considered under the scheme.This Summit will encourage investors looking to build global champions in India in these products. It may be recalled that 13 companies have already been selected under the PLI scheme for medical devices earlier this year which will support their investment in enhancing domestic manufacturing of targeted devices.The sessions will also cover the financing of the burgeoning start-up ecosystem, and it will culminate with a session on providing comprehensive facilitation to applicants selected under the PLI schemes about the smooth grounding of investments.   (ANI/2 days ago) https://www.newkerala.com/more-news.php

title: You Can't Stop BBI, Kenyatta-Odinga Allies Tell DP William Ruto
description: [Nation] President Uhuru Kenyatta's and ODM leader Raila Odinga's allies have told off Deputy President William Ruto over threats to stop the ongoing countrywide Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) rallies.
text: President Uhuru Kenyatta's and ODM leader Raila Odinga's allies have told off Deputy President William Ruto over threats to stop the ongoing countrywide Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) rallies.  Dr Ruto, while attending a church service at Gatunduri Full Gospel Church in Embu County on Sunday, accused some BBI proponents of inciting tribes against each other.  TRIBAL ANIMOSITY  He claimed that politicians in Mr Odinga's Orange Democratic Movement (ODM) have been using the rallies to fuel tribal animosity.  "If the reggae which is being witnessed at BBI rallies is about preaching [negative] ethnicity and profiling some communities, then we shall stop it," he said.  President Kenyatta's and Mr Odinga's allies Monday criticised Dr Ruto over his remarks. The leaders said not all proposals made by regional leaders will be included in the final BBI report.  They said that Dr Ruto has no moral authority to stop the rallies on the basis of sentiments that would not influence the final report.  Cherangany MP Joshua Kutuny claimed the DP has always been against the BBI.  "If he [Dr Ruto] wants to oppose BBI, he has an option of saying yes or no. We are not forcing anyone to subscribe to our school of thought. Only Uhuru and Raila can stop the drive," said Mr Kutuny.  He said that not all what leaders say will be included in the final BBI report.  "The only way they can stop the reggae is to oppose it. They can oppose the reggae and give us blues or RNB or even Lingala. He (Ruto) can come up with another vibe," Mr Kutuny said, adding that the DP's sentiments were "desperate" attempts by the anti-BBI brigade to stop the drive.  STOP RALLIES  Kakamega Senator Cleophas Malala and Nyeri Town MP Wambugu Ngunjiri said the DP cannot stop the rallies "because he did not start them."  "He has no capacity. He has more pressing issues to deal with before he drags himself into the BBI conversation. Let him clear his name in the multiple corruption cases he has been implicated in," said Mr Malala.  Mr Ngunjiri noted that the Deputy President cannot stop the BBI rallies because he did not start them.  Nominated MP Godfrey Osotsi said the problem with Dr Ruto and his allies is that their BBI catch-up strategy is not working.  "The BBI train has left the station but they are struggling to hang on a fast moving BBI train. All their dirty schemes against BBI have crumbled. They tried to sneak the BBI report to Parliament, it didn't work. They tried to conduct parallel rallies, it never worked. They tried to introduce Luhya supremacy narrative ahead of Kakamega rally, it never worked," said Mr Osotsi.  He added: "They then tried to hijack BBI rally in Kitui, it never worked. They tried to cause unnecessary drama in Narok by raising petty issues on language translation issues, it did not work. They are panicking and facing a political catastrophe as evidenced by numerous leaders who are exiting their camp to join BBI train."  The ANC nominated MP said Dr Ruto should be bold enough to oppose BBI instead of sending mixed signals that are contradicting his boss President Kenyatta.  HANDSHAKE  "They can't also purport to support BBI while at the same time belittling the handshake. The handshake and BBI are intertwined. Incessant attacks on Raila are a direct attack on Uhuru and his government," added Mr Osotsi.  MPs Chris Omulele (Luanda), Florence Mutua (Busia County) and Elisha Odhiambo (Gem) said the BBI train had taken off and only the two principals -- President Kenyatta and Mr Odinga -- with the support of Kenyans can stop it.  "The Deputy President should wake up and smell the coffee. BBI is bigger than him. It is a national re-evaluation of our ethics, cohesion and aspirations," Mr Omulele said.  He added: "It was mooted by the President and Mr Odinga on behalf of Kenyans and the DP does not need to be reminded of this."  "If the DP imagines that the BBI is about him and his personal ambitions, he has missed the train by a mile. He will, therefore, not be available to dance to music he can't hear or understand because he will simply have failed to attend the party," added Mr Omulele.  Ms Mutua said that "in as much as I personally don't support any tribal whipping and incitement, it is also wrong to use what one leader said to try and blame it on BBI."  "No one will stop reggae and the DP and his supporters should come to the BBI meetings and air their views too," Ms Mutua said.  THREATS  Gem MP Elisha Odhiambo cautioned Dr Ruto against issuing threats over the BBI drive.  "Let him stop his threats and pettiness. No one can stop a mass movement," said Mr Odhiambo.  On Sunday, Dr Ruto told leaders, whom he did not name, that Kenya is a God-fearing nation and that a few self-centred people will not be allowed to plunge it into political turmoil.  "When the leaders spoke at Narok's BBI rally, they spoke of dividing Kenyans. As the government, this is not what we want."  He stressed that the BBI is meant to unite Kenyans, not divide them.  After violence was witnessed at the BBI rally in Kitui County, DP Ruto noted that this is not the way to approach the debate.  He said bridges cannot be built with violence and that each person has a right to be heard as the BBI matter concerns all Kenyans.

title: Q&A: Cityblock's new CEO on how to personalize care and build trust with patients
description: No description
text: Cityblock Health announced Tuesday that co-founder Dr. Toyin Ajayi will take the startup's helm as its next chief executive. Ajayi succeeds fellow co-founder Iyah Romm, who stepped down to focus on his mental health. The appointment marks a new chapter for the Brooklyn-based startup, which has raised almost $900 million since its formation in 2017 to serve publicly-insured, low-income patients. Cityblock now boasts more than 1,000 employees and is reportedly valued at nearly $6 billion. Ajayi faces the challenge of scaling a business that is focused on personalized, community-centered care—and, in doing so, proving whether scale and personalization are compatible. Cityblock operates in New York, Connecticut, Massachusetts, North Carolina, Washington, D.C., and will expand into Ohio later this year, with more markets to come. What does personalized care mean to you? It means meeting people where they are and understanding that health care and health outcomes are not just a function of your diagnoses, lab tests or one organ system or the other. Understanding someone's mental health and social health and wellbeing is just as important, if not more important, than their physical health and wellbeing. You may have diabetes or high blood pressure or an autoimmune disease. There's research about what specific intervention medically we could use for each person, [but] what matters the most is that we understand how this is contextualized in your life. If you're hungry every day, if you don't have enough money to put food on the table, if you're super lonesome and struggling to feel connected — that matters just as much as the specific diagnoses that you have. We would be doing you a disservice by giving you exactly the same treatment plan as we give somebody who wasn't hungry or who wasn't lonely. We're recognizing the specific dimensions of each individual we serve. What is one question health care providers should be asking their patients? Can I have two? I've long believed that the answers to these two questions are actually really predictive of a person's overall needs and their outcomes. The first question is, "Is there a single human being in the health care system that you know, and trust deeply, who would recognize you — and you would recognize them by name — if you saw them out of context? The other question I ask is, "Is there a person in your personal life who you know deeply and trust, who you would entrust decision making to if you're unable to make decisions for yourself?" When we discharge people from the hospital, many people run into trouble. That's why our readmission rates are so high. They can't remember what their medication list was. They were supposed to be taking insulin three times a day, but they don't have enough food to take with their medication. Who are they going to call? A big part of why Cityblock is so special is that we fill that gap. How do you build trust among patients who lost faith in the health care system or never had any to begin with? First of all, you show up with humility, and you show up recognizing that you have to earn that trust, that it's not going to be given to you. We ask questions, state our intent. You ask them for permission to learn more about what's going on. You show up and act like you care. You treat people with respect and with dignity, like you want to be treated or would want your loved one to be treated. You do what you say you're going to do. When you say you're going to show up, you show up. Folks who have lived experience, who come from the communities that we're serving, are often much better positioned to earn trust than a doctor in a white coat hammering on about clinical things. Showing up with a persona and orientation that's aligned around the member and their needs, wants and desires is really important. The other thing is being respectful but tenacious. You don't give up on people. We show up consistently, respectfully, tenaciously and continue to earn that relationship. New York's Medicaid program could see a lot of changes with the next budget. What do you think state lawmakers should do or not do? The core tenets that we continue to push for remain the same: integration of physical and behavioral health services on the Medicaid side and for people who are dually eligible for Medicare and Medicaid. We push for a policy that expands and safeguards access to substance use treatment. We have benefited so much from partnerships with community-based providers, and this is where the opportunity is to augment the funding that community providers receive The evidence shows us over and over again that we can keep people out of the hospital if we provide them with person-centered, high quality, proactive, community-based care — if we strengthen the safety nets provided in the community around health and social services. —Maya Kaufman   Hackensack Meridian, Englewood merger dealt major blow in appeals court Hackensack Meridian Health's plan to acquire rival Englewood Health is all but dead after a federal appeals court indicated that it would run afoul of antitrust laws. The U.S. Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit on Tuesday upheld a decision to temporarily block the merger, after the Federal Trade Commission filed a complaint alleging the deal was unlawful. The panel of three judges agreed that the deal likely would lessen competition in the New Jersey hospital market and drive up health care prices. Federal law prohibits mergers that might substantially lessen competition or create a monopoly. "In recent years, Hackensack has acquired other health providers, each time raising prices at the acquired facility," the judges wrote in their decision, adding, "Past behavior is often indicative of future behavior." The New Jersey health systems signed the merger agreement in 2019. Hackensack Meridian—which, with 16 hospitals in its network, is the state's largest health system—pledged $439.5 million in capital investments over eight years as part of the deal. Representatives from both systems argued the merger would offer such benefits as upgrades and increased capacity limits at Englewood Hospital and the expansion of complex tertiary and quaternary care at Hackensack University Medical Center. Englewood Health operates a community hospital in Bergen County, where Hackensack runs two hospitals as well as a physician network and health foundation. The appeals court Tuesday countered that the "claimed benefits were speculative or non-merger-specific" and did not outweigh the merger's expected impact on prices. An expert for the FTC projected the hospitals would be able to increase prices by $31 million after the merger. "Although this is not the decision we had hoped for, we entered merger planning from a position of strength," Englewood Health said in a statement. "Englewood Health will continue to move forward with our strategic plan, enhancing our services and improving access for patients and communities across northern New Jersey." Hackensack Meridian said it is weighing next steps. "We firmly believe this merger is in the best interest of our patients and the community at large," the system said in a statement. The FTC's complaint against the proposed merger is slated for an administrative trial in 30 days. —M.K.   Midtown opioid nonprofit doles out $11M in grants The Foundation for Opioid Response Efforts on Tuesday announced the distribution of nearly $11 million in grants to nine organizations and universities across the country specializing in prevention, treatment, intervention and recovery. The Midtown-based, grant-making nonprofit funds organizations with resources to address the opioid crisis. During the past two years, FORE has awarded 64 grants totaling nearly $30 million for projects aimed at combating opioid use. Its latest $10.9 million outlay is the second largest since FORE was established in October 2018 and one that occurred after a lengthy request-for-proposal process. "We received 400 applications from organizations across the country," said Dr. Karen Scott, FORE president. "We're very excited about the nine we selected and announced today." Many of the projects funded by the new grants target the adverse effect of opioid use on families and focus on treatment for children exposed to opioid use by their parents or caregivers. A $1.5 million grant to the Morgan County Partnership in West Virginia funds a community initiative to support children impacted by the opioid use of family members. A $439,547 grant to the Georgia Institute of Technology funds an investigation into the behavior outcomes of children exposed to parental opioid use. "We don't want to create more silos with this work. We want to make it accessible and reach as many children and families as possible," Scott said. "We look for how these interventions can be woven into places where children and families are right now." A $1.48 million grant to the Denver Health and Hospital Foundation is designed to team with doctors and investigators to integrate an adult opioid treatment model—one already developed across the city's health care network—into a system for children and families. "It will be working pediatric services into a comprehensive network of treatment that becomes family-based, rather than focused around the individuals," Scott said. FORE's grants are funded by the McKesson Corp., which donated them as a one-time gift to find opioid solutions. From 1999 to 2019 more than 500,000 Americans died from an overdose involving an opioid, according to the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. —Brian Pascus   Pfizer to supply UNICEF with enough Covid treatment for 4 million people Pfizer will sell UNICEF up to 4 million treatment courses of its Covid-19 pill for distribution in 95 low- and middle-income countries, it announced Tuesday. The Midtown East drugmaker did not disclose financial terms of the deal but said it will supply the countries with Paxlovid doses at a not-for-profit price, pending local authorization or approval. Upper-middle-income countries included in the UNICEF deal will be subject to Pfizer's tiered pricing for the Covid treatment, the company said. The drugmaker previously agreed to sell 20 million treatment courses of Paxlovid to the U.S. government for about $529 each. Pfizer did not name the 95 countries but said the list includes all low- and lower-middle-income countries in sub-Saharan Africa. "Supplying to UNICEF is an important part of our comprehensive strategy to accelerate access to Paxlovid to treat Covid-19 infection as quickly as possible and at an affordable price in order to decrease the strain on health care systems and help save lives in low- and middle-income countries," Chairmand and CEO Albert Bourla said in a statement. Paxlovid is administered as three tablets taken orally twice daily for five days. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration in December granted it an emergency-use authorization to treat mild to moderate Covid-19 in patients who are 12 or older and at high risk of developing severe symptoms. Between then and the end of the year, the treatment generated $76 million in U.S. sales for Pfizer. The company is now forecasting record revenue for this year. —M.K.   AT A GLANCE WHO'S NEWS: Debra Furr-Holden has been appointed dean of the NYU School of Global Public Health, effective July 1, the university announced Tuesday. She joins from Michigan State University, where she is a professor of public health, associate dean for public health integration and director of the NIH-funded Flint Center for Health Equity Solutions at MSU's College of Human Medicine. TRANSPLANT SUCCESS: Northwell Health announced Tuesday that its transplant center at North Shore University Hospital was rated the country's top kidney transplant program based on the one-year survival rate of its transplant recipients, according to a Scientific Registry of Transplant Recipients report that analyzed 40,000 transplants across 250 programs in the U.S. The hospital performed 225 kidney transplants between July 2018 and December 2020, the timespan used in the report. UNIVERSITY PARTNERSHIP: Long Island University and software company Dassault Systèmes have broadened their ongoing partnership to include research and innovation in the life sciences, they said Tuesday. The university will use the company's technology to advance research related to precision medicine, digital health, medical devices and pharmaceutical sciences, such as by developing exact digital models of human anatomy. NEWSLETTER UPDATE: In the coming weeks, the "Who's News" portion of "At a Glance" will transition to a paid product. "Who's News" is a daily update of career transitions in the local health care industry. For more information on submitting a listing, please reach out to Debora Stein at [email protected] CONTACT US: Have a tip about news happening in the local health care industry? Want to provide feedback about our coverage? Contact the Health Pulse team at [email protected]

title: City of Regina denies zero tolerance for FGM proclamation
description: "I was told by the city clerks office that they had declined the proclamation because they couldn't take sides on this issue."
text: “The proclamation request from End FGM Canada Network was rejected due to the lack of a local presence of the Network in Regina to support the request,” said an emailed statement from the city Monday.  But Giselle Portenier, a founding member of the Network, says the city clerk’s office told her something different over the phone last week.  “I was told by the city clerk’s office that they had declined the proclamation because they couldn’t take sides on this issue,” said Portenier from Ottawa on Monday.  “I think it’s really sad that the City of Regina is not prepared to stand up for the human rights of girls,” she said.  Despite the fact the Network itself doesn’t have a presence in Regina, Portenier said it’s still an issue that affects immigrants in Regina who came from countries like Egypt, Ethiopia, Kenya, Nigeria, Somalia and Iraq.  According to the latest data from Statistics Canada, there are more than 2,000 such immigrants living in Regina.  “All those communities in their home countries practice FGM, and so there’s almost certainty that you have survivors who are in need of support and there may be girls at risk,” said Portenier.  She said the Network has successfully applied for proclamations in 20 other Canadian cities.  Proclamation applications in Regina are assessed by the city clerk and the spirit of them, although not exclusively, is generally one of celebration, said Mayor Michael Fougere in an interview Monday.  “We try to stay away from political causes,” he added.  But Portenier says FGM is in no way a partisan issue, and she believes a lack of education led to the denial of the proclamation.  “I think in Canada, generally speaking, people are afraid to talk about FGM because they see it as a question of culture. But internationally, human rights activists … see it as child abuse and human rights abuse full-stop,” she said.  According to the World Health Organization, FGM is recognized internationally as a violation of the human rights of girls and women that reflects deep-rooted inequality between the sexes and constitutes an extreme form of discrimination against women.  Portenier called Fougere a “forward-thinking person” who cares about human rights, considering he was the first Regina mayor to raise the pride flag. She hopes the city will reconsider the application in time for  International Day of Zero Tolerance for Female Genital Mutilation Day on Thursday.  Applications are approved or denied based on the criteria laid out by the city clerk’s office.  One of those criteria is that the group must be from within Canada in order for a proclamation to be considered and approved. They must also not promote any commercial business, involve any person or organization that promotes hatred of any person or class of persons or otherwise involves illegal activity or contain any “inflammatory, obscene or libellous statement.”  In an emailed statement Monday, the city said the intent of  proclamations is to “celebrate and recognize organizations and events that are meaningful to our community and its residents.” Part of the evaluation process considers if the organization requesting the proclamation is local or has a provincial chapter, it continued.  A two-page city document that can be found online  regarding proclamation requests and the associated bylaw states the event being proclaimed must be relevant to Regina or Saskatchewan. The city was unable to provide any documentation that outlines criteria in further detail as of press time.

title: В одном из дворов в центре Киева прогремел взрыв
description: На месте ЧП работают полиция, спасатели и медики «Скорой помощи»
text: Напомним, как писал сайт kp.ru, ранее в начале мая  прогремел взрыв  у одного из бизнес-центров в украинской столице. Тогда возле здания неизвестные оставили пакет с взрывным устройством, после того, как оно сработало, начался пожар. Очевидцы рассказали, что заметили двух подозрительных мужчин, которые и оставили сверток рядом со зданием.

title: Coronavirus: Married for five days then a 9000km, Covid-19 separation
description: They've been forced oceans apart by a global pandemic, but a 24/7 video link keeps this couple together
text: At Alan Grainger's parents home in the Bay of Plenty town of Omokoroa, there's a video link kept permanently open to Malaysia, almost 9000km away.  For now, that's the only way Grainger can communicate with his wife Boey - who he married just 12 days ago.  The couple tied the knot on March 12, and by March 19 he was on a plane heading to New Zealand.  An expiring visa, and a ban on Malaysians leaving the country, has forced the young couple apart.  Alan Grainger's quarantine set up, with the permantly open video link on the left to wife Boey, 9000km away in Malaysia.  That advice prompted a whirlwind of travel arrangements.  "Email from New Zealand High Commission came through at 1.30pm, booked ticket, packed and one hour drive to be at the airport at 3.30pm for flight at 6.30pm."  He said he booked a flight back online and paid $1500, a price that quickly climbed to $4500.  Alan Grainger and wife Boey at the registration part of their March 12 wedding.  Grainger said that unsurprisingly, the airport farewell was an emotional experience and one he felt guilty about.  "Both of us tried not to think too much about it."  He said he was tempted to flout visa rules and remain with his wife, but the risk of earning a permanent ban from re-entering the country was too great a risk.  The normally packed Singapore Airport.  Grainger agreed a Malaysian prison might not be the best place to be in a global pandemic.  He said the journey was something of an eerie experience, especially seeing places like the normally packed airport in Singapore almost deserted.  "Everyone on the plane had a mask on, hand sanitiser. I basically didn't touch anything," he said.  He said the lockdown is Malaysia is enforced to such an extent, you could expect to be arrested if outside. Trips to the supermarket only are currently being allowed.  He also said the level of information being made available online to the public there was extremely detailed.  "You can see every single case and the details of the case, but the country has ground to a halt."  Despite the separation from his wife, and the fact his initial quarantine will now extended further thanks for the country's month long lockdown, Grainger laughs often and is keeping cheerful.  He said he hasn't been bored at the house, where his parents and sister are also residing in a three-way quarantine.  He said he feels healthy too.  The mood only darkens when the prospect of the lockdown extending beyond the initial month is mentioned.  "If it is extended, it's going to start getting pretty grim."  He said he hopes New Zealanders cooperate with the lockdown, for everyone's sake.  He's already got plans too for when he next sees his wife.
